melee.name: Melee
melee.description: This creature excels at close combat and has limited or no ranged combat capabilities.

range.name: range
range.description: This creature attacks from afar and has limited or no Melee combat capabilities.

ambush.name: Ambush
ambush.description: This creature ideally starts combat from a hidden position and waits for the optimal moment to attack.

Airborne.name: Airborne
Airborne.description: This creature has a flying speed and can continuously stay at a distance.

charge.name: Charge
charge.description: This creature seeks close combat from the get-go and will continue to do so.

predator.name: Predator
predator.description: This creature stalks its prey and will withdraw from combat to attack again later.

pack.name: Pack
pack.description: This creature is best utilized as part of a larger group of similar creatures.

regeneration.name: Regeneration
regeneration.description: This creature has abilities allowing it to regenerate hit points during combat.

mobile.name: Mobile
mobile.description: This creature boasts superior speed and mobility, allowing it to quickly reposition itself or give chase to enemies.

tactical.name: Tactical
tactical.description: This creature's abilities facilitate powerful synergies, increasing its effectiveness.

shock.name: Shock
shock.description: This creature is most effective during the first turns of combat.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
spellcasting.description: This creature is capable of casting spells and favours using them in combat.

demanding.name: Demanding
demanding.description: Fighting this monster requires lots of saving throws.

simple.name: Simple
simple.description: This creature's abilites are straightfoward and require little planning to utilize effectively.

lethal.name: Lethal
lethal.description: This creature is more than capable of actually killing a player character.

Area of Effect.name: Area of Effect
Area of Effect.description: This creature heavily utilizes abilities that affect an area, for example by dealing damage to creatures within that area.

interactive.name: Interactive
interactive.description: This creature utilizes a combination of abilities, actions, bonus actions and reactions.

boss.name: Boss
boss.description: This creature boasts impressive stats and abilities, requiring several turns of intense combat that acts as a dramatic climax.

bodyguard.name: Bodyguard
bodyguard.description: This creature aims to protect another creature, rarely leaving its side and acting in the interest of keeping danger from it.

debuff.name: Debuff
debuff.description: This creature weakens or hinders its enemies.

support.name: Support
support.description: This creature strengthens its allies, increasing their effectiveness, but often poses less of a challenge on its own.

tank.name: Tank
tank.description: This creature is extremely resilient, boasting a combination of a high hit point count or AC, resistances or immunities.

minion.name: Minion
minion.description: This creature is relatively harmless on its own and its strength lies in numbers.

damage.name: Damage
damage.description: This creature can be utilized as a reliable source of damage.

mount.name: Mount
mount.description: This creature can serve as a mount for either a player or an enemy.

ally.name: Ally
ally.description: This creature can act as an ally to a group of players.

pressure.name: Pressure
pressure.description: This creature provides unique challenges able to overwhelm its enemies.

hunter.name: Hunter
hunter.description: This creature concentrates its attention on single targets.

leader.name: Leader
leader.description: This creature is best utilized as the leader of a group of enemies, acting as a lynchpin for the encounter.

duelist.name: Duelist
duelist.description: This creature's set of abilities allows for an exciting back and forth with a single opponent.

gimmick.name: Gimmick
gimmick.description: This creature possesses one or more gimmicks, specific and unique mechanics, that an encounter with this creature will revolve around.

swallow.name: Swallow
swallow.description: This creature can and will swallow players, splitting parties and possibly dealing damage over time.

critter.name: Critter
critter.description: A low-CR creature posing almost no challenge by itself, therefore rarely used in combat. Usually used for flavor, worldbuilding, or odd encounters.

vehicle.name: Vehicle
vehicle.description: Constructed for warfare or transport, a vehicle usually has to be crewed and rarely serves as an opponent on its own.

classic.name: Classic
classic.description: A widely recognized or frequently used monster type. Common across many campaigns and representative of core setting themes.

legendary.name: Legendary
legendary.description: This creature poses a formidable and complex challenge, makes use of legendary actions and requires special attention regarding the conception and execution of an encounter with it.

000-goblin_pack_1_crookshank.description: Crookshanks mark the rank and file of a Raid Rabble, both conscripted and willing participants of mixed age and skill. Most goblins are used to fight creatures larger than them and they make the most of it, trying to swarm enemies to bring them down, where their eponymous crooked blades are waiting. Goblins aren't eager to die fighting, as each dead goblin weakens the tribe. This utilitarian view on survival has earned them a reputation of cowardice, but if Goblins commit to a fight, they do so without hesitation, fully aware of their mortality and knowing that their death will only empower the raid, as their Shaman draws great strength from them.
000-goblin_pack_1_crookshank.name: Goblin Crookshank

000-goblin_pack_1_hog_rider.description: Hog Riders are brawny and boorish, characteristics they share with their black-bristled mounts. They are veterans of several raids, having earned their place upon the back of a towering boar. They are fast in and fast out, barreling forth from the underbrush and into the thick of combat before turning on their heel, grabbing what they can and retreating once the rest of the Rabble swarms in. Once the baggage is secured, the rest of the Raid Rabble retreats back into cover, with arrows and grenades raining unto eventual pursuers from hidden Shrublurkers.
000-goblin_pack_1_hog_rider.name: Goblin Hog Rider

000-goblin_pack_1_rabble_rouser.description: Within the confines of a goblin village everyone has to pull their weight. There is no place for ego, grudges or feuds, as time is better spent improving the ever slim chances of the tribe's survival than to indulge in petty conflicts. Some goblins chafe under this, for reasons of temper, personality or sheer stubborn obstinacy. A Raid Rabble is a great way to send these Rabble-Rousers to blow off some steam, before they start developing some dangerous thoughts. This is a win-win situation, as they make for furious warriors, passionate looters and grandstanding braggarts, taking their attention away from getting into trouble, continuously telling of their heroic deeds instead. That is, if they return.
000-goblin_pack_1_rabble_rouser.name: Goblin Rabble Rouser

000-goblin_pack_1_shrublurker.description: Shrublurkers spend most of their life outside the confines of a goblin village and are both feared and respected for it. Children like to test boundaries and explore their surroundings, goblin childred are no different. If they venture to far from the village, chances of survival are slim. But those who return exhibit a knack for survival and necessary amount of luck that qualifies them for adoption by a senior Shrublurker, the old veteran hoping to impart as much knowledge as possible on their successor before their inevitable death. Shrublurkers are expert trackers and trappers and are forced to quickly adapt to the flora and fauna surrounding their village or die an early death. During a raid, Shrublurkers act as scouts, sharpshooters and saboteurs, exposing key weaknesses or marking priority targets.
000-goblin_pack_1_shrublurker.name: Goblin Shrublurker

000-goblin_pack_1_soulshaper_shaman.description: Soulshaper Shamans oversee a tribe's death rites and stand vigil during the transition of a goblin's soul beyond the mortal veil. They do this to take note of where this particular soul goes, to eventually drag it back to fulfill various purposes, should the need arise. Necessity is the mother of invention, goblins die in droves - why not capitalise on that? The goblins are thankful for their ancestor's service and both live and die knowing that their duty does not end in death. A Shaman's word carries a lot of weight, as they are known to converse with the spirits of the afterlife and carry the knowledge of the ancestors. Most shamans however quickly find out that dying does not automatically impart knowledge and most ancestors are as dense in death as they were in life. This realisation usually sours a Soulshaper Shaman's mood and factors into their characteristic bitterness.
000-goblin_pack_1_soulshaper_shaman.name: Goblin Soulshaper Shaman

000-goblin_pack_1_soulstarved_abominatio.description: The shambling and frankly horrifying Soulstarved Abominations are Soulshaper Shaman's failed attempt to just kind of stuff a goblin's soul back into a vessel, be it their former body or an vaguely goblin-shaped flesh-construct. Still, something must have worked out as planned, as these aptly named Abominations walk and fight, despite their unsettling appearence and even more unsettling hunger for flesh. If a Soulshaper Shaman is part of a Raid Rabble, the Abominations can be found shuffling in its wake, herded by their creator into combat as unliving weapons.
000-goblin_pack_1_soulstarved_abominatio.name: Goblin Soulstarved Abomination

000-month_1_bone_hag.description: Bone Hags abhor Civilized's ever expanding need for greater cities and more farmland.They regard each village as nothing but a malign growth with the potential to mutate into a tumorous City if left unchecked. As they draw strength from their bindings to the bones of the earth, the very essence of the primordial titans who gave up their bodies to create room for earthbound life, they require earth and stone untouched by tools or stonecraft, violently subduing any outside attempts to encroach on their domains.
000-month_1_bone_hag.name: Bone Hag

000-month_10_skeleton_dragon.description: A dragon's might appears to be limited only by the constraints of a physical form, forcing it to obey the laws of mortality, as they already ignore those of physics, displaying this particular brand of hybris everytime they take flight. Imagine now this creature no lounger bound to a mortal shell, instead transcending the border between life and death to become something even greater, something even more terrifying. Wreathed in night-coloured soulfire and with a malign spark lightning up its empty eye sockets, a Skeleton Dragon is a draconic nightmare given form, its mere presence draining colour from life and hope from the heart of mortal folk.
000-month_10_skeleton_dragon.name: Skeleton Dragon

000-month_11_mother_base.description: Since its inception, various models of the Mobile Operations Transport and Headquarters for Exploration and Reconnaissance Base - or in short Mother Base - serve as a staging post for governmental or private operations, scientific expeditions or incursions into the planar cosmos. Powered by experimental arcane reactors and highly classified clockwork magic, outfitted with different means of environmental traversal and equipped with state of the art weaponry, Mother Base is highly automated and can even act autonomously, lending fire support or tactical assistance to its crew. However, its developers notice with increasing concern that Mother Base units start to develop close bonds with their pilots and crew over time, even behaving irrationally, acting outside of permitted protocol or in other ways considered impossible to protect or even avenge their attached unit.
000-month_11_mother_base.name: M.O.T.H.E.R. Base

000-month_12_dreamweaver.description: Dreamweavers are the single-minded offspring of the Weavstress. With their oneiric toxins, they are able to manipulate the flow of the Dreamweave, the illusory realm through which the victims of the Weavstress sleepwalk, in order to exert direct control over the behavior of the dreamers.
000-month_12_dreamweaver.name: Dreamweaver

000-month_12_weavstress.description: The Weavstress is a sinister creature, the extent of its cruel and deceitful nature hidden behind this unassuming title. This colossal arachnid weaves its silvery threads into intricate traps, capable of spinning almost invisible, delicate strands and massive ropes with the strength of steel cables. These threads are soaked in narcotic secretions, inducing hallucinations or narcoleptic episodes. Sleeping creatures are then controlled by the Weavstresses spider-like brood, the Dreamweavers, through narcotic poisons, acting against their will and dancing to the ethereal tunes of the Weavstresses' haunting song.
000-month_12_weavstress.name: Weavstress

000-month_13_chimera.description: Technically, any monstrosity combining the traits of various beasts within a creature is a chimera. But there are instances, where magical happenstance, particularly repulsive instances of procreation or especially ambitious broodmasters create something greater than the sum of its parts, a bestial force driven by a need for domination, channeling the pain and madness coursing through its unnatural body into a destructive force that is terrifying to behold.
000-month_13_chimera.name: Chimera

000-month_14_dwarven_battlebrewer.description: Brewing is more than just a craft for dwarves; it's a cultural cornerstone deeply intertwined with the local identity of their decentralized and often isolated societies. Each mountain kingdom or cavernous realm, has their unique brews enriched with customs and culture. Whether it's hearty whiskey with hints of volcanic smoke, clear schnapps with sparkling mineral particles, or strong beer brewed from underground river water, they all have the power to soothe weary hands and quickly loosen knotted muscles. With their potent brews, Battle-Brewers specialize in maintaining the esprit de corps and, with their down-to-earth and jovial nature, they ease the hardships of military life, all while never hesitating to get their hands dirty themselves.
000-month_14_dwarven_battlebrewer.name: Dwarven Battle-Brewer

000-month_14_dwarven_brewers_barrel.description: Brewing is more than just a craft for dwarves; it's a cultural cornerstone deeply intertwined with the local identity of their decentralized and often isolated societies. Each mountain kingdom or cavernous realm, has their unique brews enriched with customs and culture. Whether it's hearty whiskey with hints of volcanic smoke, clear schnapps with sparkling mineral particles, or strong beer brewed from underground river water, they all have the power to soothe weary hands and quickly loosen knotted muscles. With their potent brews, Battle-Brewers specialize in maintaining the esprit de corps and, with their down-to-earth and jovial nature, they ease the hardships of military life, all while never hesitating to get their hands dirty themselves.
000-month_14_dwarven_brewers_barrel.name: Dwarven Brewers Barrel

000-month_14_dwarven_brewers_boarcart.description: Traditionally, the Battle-Brewers carts are pulled by mighty boars, serving both as beasts of burden and defenders of the Brewer's mobile tavern and improvised brewery. These boars are nurtured from birth and raised on a secret diet, likely involving copious amounts of dwarven spirits, to enhance their already considerable combat prowess.
000-month_14_dwarven_brewers_boarcart.name: Dwarven Brewer's Boar Cart

000-month_14_giant_boar.description: Countless royal hunting expeditions have been thrown into disarray by the ferocity of a single regular boar, leaving a trail of hunters scarred by their encounters - not all living to tell the tale. Giants among their already towering kind, giant boars dwarf their ordinary brethren, doubling in stature and quadrupling in mass. When a rampaging giant boar charges, conventional methods falter, and its onslaught often rivals the devastation normally reserved for natural disasters.
000-month_14_giant_boar.name: Giant Boar

000-month_15_bear.description: When one encounters a full-grown bear in the wild, it becomes clear why people started building walls. Bulky slabs of muscle shifting under an armor of dense fur and tough skin that can resist even blades, powerful jaws and giant, mighty paws - Bears are faster, stronger, and more mobile than most humanoid beings, and their legendary resilience has inspired many tribal societies to revere the bear totem as a symbol of primal fortitude.
000-month_15_bear.name: Bear

000-month_15_crocodile.description: Crocodiles appear to sport a self-satisfied grin, almost as if they're aware they're a pinnacle of evolutionary success. While others had to develop fins or feet to find their niche, those very appendages often ended up on the menu of lurking crocodiles. The stars of their own evolutionary success story ensure that life near water remains thrilling.
000-month_15_crocodile.name: Crocodile

000-month_15_shaman.description: From shaman-kings who rule tribal societies by a mandate granted by the ancestral spirits, reclusive hermits safeguarding the balance and harmony of nature, to storm-callers and earth-shakers whose words unleash the full fury of elemental wrath, shamans are pivotal figures in societies that, through a deep connection to nature and ancestral worship, have not lost their link to the past and the surrounding natural world.
000-month_15_shaman.name: Shaman

000-month_16_cathedral_knight.description: Cathedral Knights are towering undead tasked with guarding the great Cathedral of Silence, the spiritual center of the Deathrite Cult. Drawn from the Unspeaking, the undead martial elite of the Cult, they bask in the soundless tolling of the great cathedral's leaden bells, causing them to grow to towering size over time. Cathedral Knights are deployed to crush particularly obstinate enemies of the Cult and are always accompanied by Bell Ringers, empowering the Cathedral Knights with deathrite rituals and maintaining the shroud of blessed silence.
000-month_16_cathedral_knight.name: Cathedral Knight

000-month_16_deathrite_bellringer.description: Cathedral Knights are towering undead tasked with guarding the great Cathedral of Silence, the spiritual center of the Deathrite Cult. Drawn from the Unspeaking, the undead martial elite of the Cult, they bask in the soundless tolling of the great cathedral's leaden bells, causing them to grow to towering size over time. Cathedral Knights are deployed to crush particularly obstinate enemies of the Cult and are always accompanied by Bell Ringers, empowering the Cathedral Knights with deathrite rituals and maintaining the shroud of blessed silence.
000-month_16_deathrite_bellringer.name: Deathrite Bellringer

000-month_17_cursed_cannon.description: The 12th of 13 comically oversized ship cannons commissioned by a pirate queen, now purged from history, to arm the flagship of her ill-fated fleet. The entire fleet vanished under mysterious circumstances without firing a single shot while traversing the waters near the Bleak Reef. Now, deprived of her baptism of fire and somehow salvaged from her watery Graves, this mass of barnacles and iron is suffused with the vengeful thoughts of the ship, captain, and crew. It thirsts for the scent of gunpowder and the shattering of planks, with vengeful energies coalescing within this magnificent weapon, ready to unleash hell even as its wood remains in a continuous state of rot and its once polished metal is thick with rust. A magnificent heavyweight of an enemy for any hard-hitting maritime encounter!
000-month_17_cursed_cannon.name: Drusilla the Drowned

000-month_18_duskshroud_wyvern.description: The transition between day and night marks a special time, a liminal space at the border between light and darkness. Two domains, eternally intertwined in primordial duality, merge for a brief moment, creating a fleeting moment of balance. This space is the hunting ground of Duskshroud Wyverns, light-born and night-clad minor dragons who use the dim twilight hours to lurk at the edge of night, moving in eerie silence and killing with cold delight.
000-month_18_duskshroud_wyvern.name: Duskshroud Wyvern

000-month_19_shamblevault_casket_bearer.description: The Shamblevaults are hidden oubliette-structures where hordes of undead creatures are imprisoned, awaiting the call of their master to be summoned when needed. Through massive blackwood caskets, ambitious necromancers can draw forth undead abominations directly from the nightmarish depths of these vaults. The towering Casket Bearers, hulking figures bound to their masters' will, provide the perfect solution to the logistical challenge of hauling around a colossal, chain-wrapped sarcophagus.
000-month_19_shamblevault_casket_bearer.name: Shamblevault Casket Bearer

000-month_2_magma_wyrm.description: Magma Wyrms inhabit the most inhospitable terrain imaginable, breeding at the black sand shores of great lava lakes or within the noxious calderas of active volcanoes. Glowing red with inner heat and covered in glistening obdsidan scales, fighting these great Wyrms head on is foolhardy bordering suicidal and only the greatest (or most boastful) dwarven heros are said to having defied a Wyrm's withering heat and extinguished its molten core.
000-month_2_magma_wyrm.name: Magma Wyrm

000-month_20_shade_tyrant.description: Fallen knights, oathbroken and consumed by shadows, return as dreaded Shade Tyrants.
000-month_20_shade_tyrant.name: Shade Tyrant

000-month_20_slaveshade.description: Slaveshades serve Shade Tyrants, created by their dark masters from stolen shadows.
000-month_20_slaveshade.name: Slaveshade

000-month_23_living_fossil_ankylosaurus.description: Ancient fossils infused with primordial magic awaken, combining primal might and elemental power.
000-month_23_living_fossil_ankylosaurus.name: Living Fossil Ankylosaurus

000-month_23_living_fossil_quetzalcoatlu.description: Ancient fossils infused with primordial magic awaken, combining primal might and elemental power.
000-month_23_living_fossil_quetzalcoatlu.name: Living Fossil Quetzalcoatlus

000-month_23_living_fossil_smilodon.description: Ancient fossils infused with primordial magic awaken, combining primal might and elemental power.
000-month_23_living_fossil_smilodon.name: Living Fossil Smilodon

000-month_23_living_fossil_tyrannosaurus.description: Ancient fossils infused with primordial magic awaken, combining primal might and elemental power.
000-month_23_living_fossil_tyrannosaurus.name: Living Fossil Tyrannosaurus

000-month_3_draconic_elite.description: Draconic Elites are otherworldly might given vaguely humanoid shape, towering man-dragons boasting a scaled hide, reptilian maw and scything talons. Their winged, bipedal grants them total aerial superiority, skilled Elites capable of outmaneuvering even their ancestral patrons. As guardians of ancient ruins, instruments of divine judgment or a greater dragon's equerry, their presence invokes both fear and reverence, their martial prowess a testament to the potency of this convergence.
000-month_3_draconic_elite.name: Draconic Elite

000-month_4_valkyrie.description: The Valkyrie's purpose transcends mere escorts of the fallen, for they are seekers of the Allfather's mightiest foes across all realms. Traversing the boundless expanse of countless worlds, they remain unyielding in their quest, the relentless pursuit of proving their mettle, that they may someday prove skillful enough to perceive the skeins of fate, recognizing warriors worthy of a place within the golden halls of heroism. Forged in the fires of battle and beaten into shape upon the anvil of her expectations, there are no greater warriors than those growing under the winged shadow of the Allfather's champions.
000-month_4_valkyrie.name: Valkyrie

000-month_5_crownbreaker_archwyvern.description: Crownbreaker Archwyverns are the equivalent of a sentient tornado deciding that it wants to battle the nearest earthquake for catastrophic supremacy. Crownbreakers live to fight for the top of the food chain, tirelessly working their way from territory to territory, domain to domain, tirelessly challenging the rulers of those realms - be they other wyverns, chimeras, giants or even true dragons. Through physical strength, raw aggression, and ceaseless savagery alone, these colossal Arch-Wyverns manage to triumph over opponents that seem many times more powerful than their challengers. With each victory, the Arch-Wyvern emerges stronger, and with each triumph, it comes closer to its goal of absolute martial dominance.
000-month_5_crownbreaker_archwyvern.name: Crownbreaker Archwyvern

000-month_6_emissary_of_annihilation.description: The Emissaries of Annihilation are dedicated to the eradication of all life from the universe. They have long abandoned their organic bodies and now act as constructed conduits for an all-annihilating force of non-organic decay. They have created cosmic disciplines that tap into the deconstructive power of complete negation and null-essence to obliterate beings, magic, or even space itself, leaving gaping wounds in reality and motes of dust weightlessly drifting before dispersing, their origin soon to be forgotten by an unfeeling universe.
000-month_6_emissary_of_annihilation.name: Emissary Of Annihilation

000-month_7_azure_dragon_sage.description: Dragon-Sages travel the world, offering their wisdom and experience to those whose philosophies align with their own. Most of them are hundreds of years old, and their gaze discerns patterns and causalities that remain hidden to most. Thus, they assume various roles, from saviors to destroyers, to steer the course of history in a way that aligns with their own nature. Characteristic of Azure Dragon-Sages is the pursuit of freedom for all peoples, and their arrival often heralds revolution and reformation. Some act as advisors, being able to foretel the future by discerning cloud patterns, some as elite instructors or even military leaders, their troops marching to the drum-beat of distant thunder.
000-month_7_azure_dragon_sage.name: Azure Dragon Sage

000-month_8_lord_of_dust.description: The Ankhir Empire crumbled under the tireless assaults of their unliving former kings and generals, the populace being massacred by those they once worshiped. Soon the numbing desert sand settled on the sunken ruins of sprawling cities, with only the pyramidical god-prisons looming in quiet reminiscence of a cursed realm swallowed by the sand. Woe betide those who stumble upon the ruins of old, cursed Ankh! If roused from their slumber, the forgotten horrors will surely redden the sands once more.
000-month_8_lord_of_dust.name: Lord of Dust

000-month_9_forge_devil.description: Forge Devils revel in subjugation, be it the subjugation of elements within their hellish forge complexes, the submission of those who kneel to grasp a morsel of the forbidden arts and infernal intricacies of the Devil's own craftsmanship, or the subjugation of entire peoples by armies clad in hellforged iron.
000-month_9_forge_devil.name: Forge Devil

000-srd_aboleth.name: Aboleth
000-srd_aboleth.description: Lurks beneath deep waters, exerting psychic domination over weaker minds. Its mucous-coated body and psionic tendrils pose both physical and mental threats.

000-srd_acolyte.name: Acolyte
000-srd_acolyte.description: Serves temple rites and offers aid in worship, wielding simple spells to heal or hinder.

000-srd_adult_black_dragon.name: Adult Black Dragon
000-srd_adult_black_dragon.description: A malevolent swamp tyrant with powerful acid breath and cruel cunning.

000-srd_adult_blue_dragon.name: Adult Blue Dragon
000-srd_adult_blue_dragon.description: A thunderous desert sovereign wielding lightning with ruthless domination.

000-srd_adult_brass_dragon.name: Adult Brass Dragon
000-srd_adult_brass_dragon.description: Breathes scorching fire and chatters with mischievous wit.

000-srd_adult_bronze_dragon.name: Adult Bronze Dragon
000-srd_adult_bronze_dragon.description: A noble stormbringer enforcing order with lightning and command.

000-srd_adult_copper_dragon.name: Adult Copper Dragon
000-srd_adult_copper_dragon.description: A clever mountain hunter mixing lethal acid with disarming humor.

000-srd_adult_gold_dragon.name: Adult Gold Dragon
000-srd_adult_gold_dragon.description: A regal force of fire and virtue, feared by evil across realms.

000-srd_adult_green_dragon.name: Adult Green Dragon
000-srd_adult_green_dragon.description: A forest warlord spreading fear and poison through cunning schemes.

000-srd_adult_red_dragon.name: Adult Red Dragon
000-srd_adult_red_dragon.description: A tyrannical inferno raining fire and ruin from high crags.

000-srd_adult_silver_dragon.name: Adult Silver Dragon
000-srd_adult_silver_dragon.description: A proud defender of justice, cloaked in ice and ancient wisdom.

000-srd_adult_white_dragon.name: Adult White Dragon
000-srd_adult_white_dragon.description: A brutal arctic predator breathing death with freezing storms.

000-srd_air_elemental.name: Air Elemental
000-srd_air_elemental.description: A roaring vortex of wind and fury.

000-srd_airship.name: Airship
000-srd_airship.description: Floats above the clouds, bristling with weaponry and carrying troops on windswept deck, turning the skies into battlefields.

000-srd_ancient_black_dragon.name: Ancient Black Dragon
000-srd_ancient_black_dragon.description: A legendary acid-spewing nightmare ruling festering swamps with ancient hatred.

000-srd_ancient_blue_dragon.name: Ancient Blue Dragon
000-srd_ancient_blue_dragon.description: A majestic lightning tyrant whose presence shakes the desert skies.

000-srd_ancient_brass_dragon.name: Ancient Brass Dragon
000-srd_ancient_brass_dragon.description: Glitters with burnished scales, delighting in riddles and acid breath. It swoops above desert canyons, then dives with claws bared for brutal melee.

000-srd_ancient_bronze_dragon.name: Ancient Bronze Dragon
000-srd_ancient_bronze_dragon.description: A coastal champion whose thunderous might defends seas and skies alike.

000-srd_ancient_copper_dragon.name: Ancient Copper Dragon
000-srd_ancient_copper_dragon.description: A brilliant strategist whose laughter hides deadly corrosive might.

000-srd_ancient_gold_dragon.name: Ancient Gold Dragon
000-srd_ancient_gold_dragon.description: A divine dragon king whose fire and presence alter the fate of empires.

000-srd_ancient_green_dragon.name: Ancient Green Dragon
000-srd_ancient_green_dragon.description: A master manipulator whose toxic breath and guile poison entire realms.

000-srd_ancient_red_dragon.name: Ancient Red Dragon
000-srd_ancient_red_dragon.description: A cataclysmic flame sovereign whose wrath incinerates armies and cities.

000-srd_ancient_silver_dragon.name: Ancient Silver Dragon
000-srd_ancient_silver_dragon.description: A legendary protector of mortals, whose freezing wrath humbles tyrants.

000-srd_ancient_white_dragon.name: Ancient White Dragon
000-srd_ancient_white_dragon.description: An unstoppable blizzard beast ruling frozen Wastelands with brute strength.

000-srd_androsphinx.name: Androsphinx
000-srd_androsphinx.description: Perches in desert ruins, its leonine body and human visage exuding divine power as it tests intruders with riddles and crushing claws.

000-srd_animated_armor.name: Animated Armor
000-srd_animated_armor.description: Striking with mechanical precision to protect its master.

000-srd_animated_flying_sword.name: Animated Flying Sword
000-srd_animated_flying_sword.description: Striking with ethereal precision to defend its master or torment trespassers.

000-srd_animated_rug_of_smothering.name: Animated Rug of Smothering
000-srd_animated_rug_of_smothering.description: Wrapping victims in smothering folds before devouring flesh with brutal force.

000-srd_ankheg.name: Ankheg
000-srd_ankheg.description: Erupts through soil to snap victims with mandibles and spray acid.

000-srd_ankylosaurus.name: Ankylosaurus
000-srd_ankylosaurus.description: Swings its massive clubbed tail with seismic force.

000-srd_ape.name: Ape
000-srd_ape.description: Swings from branches and hurls rocks with surprising precision.

000-srd_apparatus_of_the_crab.name: Apparatus of the Crab
000-srd_apparatus_of_the_crab.description: Its iron shell protecting crews and its crushing pincers demolishing obstacles. Its steam-powered mobility transforms it into a mobile siege engine.

000-srd_arcane_eye.name: Arcane Eye
000-srd_arcane_eye.description: Floats silently, observing from afar and relaying every detail to its summoner. It cannot harm but excels at reconnaissance.

000-srd_arcane_hand.name: Arcane Hand
000-srd_arcane_hand.description: An ethereal hand follows its casterâ€™s will, crushing or manipulating objects with ghostly precision and silent efficiency.

000-srd_arcane_sword.name: Arcane Sword
000-srd_arcane_sword.description: Floats without mortal hand, spinning to deliver ethereal strikes that disrupt magic. Its blade slices through defenses with uncanny precision.

000-srd_archelon.name: Archelon
000-srd_archelon.description: Glides through ancient seas with a massive, shell-plated carapace, its beak-like jaws crushing mollusks beneath the waves.

000-srd_archmage.name: Archmage
000-srd_archmage.description: Unleashes formidable spells and manipulates the battlefield with arcane mastery, favored by powerful AOE magic.

000-srd_assassin.name: Assassin
000-srd_assassin.description: Strikes from shadows with precise backstabs, slipping away before foes can retaliate. Its smoke bombs and poisoned blades make it a master of silent elimination.

000-srd_avatar_of_death.name: Avatar of Death
000-srd_avatar_of_death.description: Glides as a spectral harbinger, its necrotic touch draining life and binding souls in silent torment.

000-srd_awakened_shrub.name: Awakened Shrub
000-srd_awakened_shrub.description: A humble shrub brought to life. Though feeble, it might intruders off guard.

000-srd_awakened_tree.name: Awakened Tree
000-srd_awakened_tree.description: A lumbering tree brought to life, often used as a guardian by nature-adjacent magic users.

000-srd_axe_beak.name: Axe Beak
000-srd_axe_beak.description: A large, flightless bird with an axe-shaped beak.

000-srd_azer_sentinel.name: Azer Sentinel
000-srd_azer_sentinel.description: A sturdy dwarf-like elemental forged in molten forges.

000-srd_baboon.name: Baboon
000-srd_baboon.description: Aggressive in groups but individually weak. More than capable of throwing careless adventurers off a tree, though.

000-srd_badger.name: Badger
000-srd_badger.description: Scurries through brambles, ferociously defending its den with sharp claws.

000-srd_balor.name: Balor
000-srd_balor.description: Wreathed in hellfire, it wields a flaming whip and a sword of flame.

000-srd_bandit.name: Bandit
000-srd_bandit.description: Strikes from cover with blade or bow, plundering and ambushing travelers on lonely roads.

000-srd_bandit_captain.name: Bandit Captain
000-srd_bandit_captain.description: Leads raiding parties with ruthless efficiency, using guile and blade to outmaneuver and overpower foes.

000-srd_barbed_devil.name: Barbed Devil
000-srd_barbed_devil.description: A lesser devil covered in barbs. A serviceable combatant, although easily overshadowed by more interesting devils, of which there are many.

000-srd_basilisk.name: Basilisk
000-srd_basilisk.description: A six-legged reptile whose gaze turns flesh to stone. Ironically, its blood can be used to revert the petrificiation.

000-srd_bat.name: Bat
000-srd_bat.description: A tiny critter used for scouting or ambiance.

000-srd_bearded_devil.name: Bearded Devil
000-srd_bearded_devil.description: A low-tier infernal warrior with a venomous beard and a cursed glaive.

000-srd_behir.name: Behir
000-srd_behir.description: Deceptively challenging serpentine monstrosity with a debilitating constrict ability and a powerful lightning breath.

000-srd_berserker.name: Berserker
000-srd_berserker.description: Charges into combat without any sense of self-prerservation.

000-srd_black_bear.name: Black Bear
000-srd_black_bear.description: Less threatening than a Grizzly or Polar Bear, more dangerous than a Koala.

000-srd_black_pudding.name: Black Pudding
000-srd_black_pudding.description: A living pool of corrosive ooze.

000-srd_blink_dog.name: Blink Dog
000-srd_blink_dog.description: A dog that can teleport, rendering leashes obsolete.

000-srd_blood_hawk.name: Blood Hawk
000-srd_blood_hawk.description: In flocks, their coordinated swoops can strip flesh from bone.

000-srd_blue_dragon_wyrmling.name: Blue Dragon Wyrmling
000-srd_blue_dragon_wyrmling.description: A desert-born hunter that strikes with lightning from surprise.

000-srd_bone_devil.name: Bone Devil
000-srd_bone_devil.description: A terrifying infernal enforcer whose poisoned sting and claws cripple foes with brutal efficiency.

000-srd_brass_dragon_wyrmling.name: Brass Dragon Wyrmling
000-srd_brass_dragon_wyrmling.description: A chatty desert wyrmling with searing breath and sleep-inducing gas

000-srd_bronze_dragon_wyrmling.name: Bronze Dragon Wyrmling
000-srd_bronze_dragon_wyrmling.description: A curious coastal guardian with a spark of lightning and justice.

000-srd_brown_bear.name: Brown Bear
000-srd_brown_bear.description: Swiping with claws that rend flesh.

000-srd_bugbear.name: Bugbear
000-srd_bugbear.description: Its hulking form and savage cunning make it a terror in stealthy raids.

000-srd_bugbear_stalker.name: Bugbear Stalker
000-srd_bugbear_stalker.description: A stealthy ambusher who grapples and strikes with brutal precision in the dark.

000-srd_bugbear_warrior.name: Bugbear Warrior
000-srd_bugbear_warrior.description: Stalks from shadow, delivering bone-crushing blows with stealthy ferocity in coordinated raids.

000-srd_bulette.name: Bulette
000-srd_bulette.description: Known as the land shark, burrows through earth to ambush its prey.

000-srd_bullywug_bog_sage.name: Bullywug Bog Sage
000-srd_bullywug_bog_sage.description: Studies swamp alchemy, weaving entangling spells.

000-srd_bullywug_warrior.name: Bullywug Warrior
000-srd_bullywug_warrior.description: Leaps from lily pad to lily pad, spear thrust ready.

000-srd_camel.name: Camel
000-srd_camel.description: Traverses desert dunes with enduring stamina, carrying heavy loads across scorching sands.

000-srd_carpet_of_flying_3_by_5_ft.name: Carpet of Flying 3 by 5 ft
000-srd_carpet_of_flying_3_by_5_ft.description: Hovers at the command of its rider, offering swift and silent aerial transport.

000-srd_carpet_of_flying_4_by_6_ft.name: Carpet of Flying 4 by 6 ft
000-srd_carpet_of_flying_4_by_6_ft.description: Hovers at the command of its rider, offering swift and silent aerial transport.

000-srd_carpet_of_flying_5_by_7_ft.name: Carpet of Flying 5 by 7 ft
000-srd_carpet_of_flying_5_by_7_ft.description: Hovers at the command of its rider, offering swift and silent aerial transport.

000-srd_carpet_of_flying_6_by_9_ft.name: Carpet of Flying 6 by 9 ft
000-srd_carpet_of_flying_6_by_9_ft.description: Hovers at the command of its rider, offering swift and silent aerial transport.

000-srd_carrion_crawler.name: Carrion Crawler
000-srd_carrion_crawler.description: Its barbed tentacles paralyzing prey while acidic saliva dissolves flesh and bone.

000-srd_celestial_steed.name: Celestial Steed
000-srd_celestial_steed.description: Bears its rider with unmatched loyalty and swift grace.

000-srd_centaur_trooper.name: Centaur Trooper
000-srd_centaur_trooper.description: Charges with spear and bow, combining equine speed with deadly accuracy.

000-srd_chain_devil.name: Chain Devil
000-srd_chain_devil.description: Snaps its barbed chains to ensnare foes with infernal torment.

000-srd_chimera.name: Chimera
000-srd_chimera.description: Bears the heads of a lion, dragon, and goat, unleashing fiery breath and savage claws in deadly combination.

000-srd_chuul.name: Chuul
000-srd_chuul.description: Paralyzing tentacles and crushing pincers drag hapless prey into murky depths.

000-srd_clay_golem.name: Clay Golem
000-srd_clay_golem.description: A massive construct with crushing fists.

000-srd_cloaker.name: Cloaker
000-srd_cloaker.description: Hides in dark caverns, coiling around victims in cold embrace.

000-srd_cloud_giant.name: Cloud Giant
000-srd_cloud_giant.description: Stands atop mountain peaks, hurling massive boulders and wielding thunderous magic to shape the skies.

000-srd_cockatrice.name: Cockatrice
000-srd_cockatrice.description: Its petrifying gaze turns flesh to stone.

000-srd_conjured_air_elemental.name: Conjured Air Elemental
000-srd_conjured_air_elemental.description: A swirling vortex of wind. Its gusts and arcane strikes overwhelm those unprepared.

000-srd_conjured_animals.name: Conjured Animals
000-srd_conjured_animals.description: A host of conjured animals appears at the casterâ€™s whim.

000-srd_conjured_earth_elemental.name: Conjured Earth Elemental
000-srd_conjured_earth_elemental.description: Its earthen fists crush all in its path.

000-srd_conjured_fey.name: Conjured Fey
000-srd_conjured_fey.description: Flits into battle at its summonerâ€™s command.

000-srd_conjured_fire_elemental.name: Conjured Fire Elemental
000-srd_conjured_fire_elemental.description: Its fiery presence incinerates obstacles in its path.

000-srd_conjured_water_elemental.name: Conjured Water Elemental
000-srd_conjured_water_elemental.description: A swirling form of water summoned to obey its master.

000-srd_constrictor_snake.name: Constrictor Snake
000-srd_constrictor_snake.description: Escape is near impossible once it tightens its grip.

000-srd_copper_dragon_wyrmling.name: Copper Dragon Wyrmling
000-srd_copper_dragon_wyrmling.description: A playful trickster with acidic breath and surprising agility.

000-srd_couatl.name: Couatl
000-srd_couatl.description: Its venomous bite and spellcasting prowess make it a fierce guardian.

000-srd_crocodile.name: Crocodile
000-srd_crocodile.description: Drags victims beneath murky waters with crushing grip.

000-srd_cultist.name: Cultist
000-srd_cultist.description: Zealously utters forbidden chants, wielding blade and dark magic.

000-srd_cultist_fanatic.name: Cultist Fanatic
000-srd_cultist_fanatic.description: Shrieks blasphemous hymns as dark energy crackles around it.

000-srd_dancing_sword.name: Dancing Sword
000-srd_dancing_sword.description: Whirlwinds through the air to strike foes without mortal hand.

000-srd_darkmantle.name: Darkmantle
000-srd_darkmantle.description: Clings to cavern ceilings, dropping silently onto victims before shrouding them in a suffocating cloak.

000-srd_death_dog.name: Death Dog
000-srd_death_dog.description: Its unholy bites prevent a regenerating rest.

000-srd_deep_gnome.name: Deep Gnome
000-srd_deep_gnome.description: Uncanny stealth and resilience make it a cunning subterranean survivor.

000-srd_deer.name: Deer
000-srd_deer.description: Its fleet hooves carry it swiftly out of harm's way.

000-srd_deva.name: Deva
000-srd_deva.description: Descends from heavenly realms, wielding a radiant sword and powerful spells to banish evil and protect the faithful.

000-srd_dire_wolf.name: Dire Wolf
000-srd_dire_wolf.description: Razor teeth and savage coordination, hunts in tightly bound packs to bring down prey.

000-srd_djinni.name: Djinni
000-srd_djinni.description: Wields storm and sand with equal mastery, summoning gusts of wind and thunderous lightning.

000-srd_doppelganger.name: Doppelganger
000-srd_doppelganger.description: Fluidly shifts its form to mimic any humanoid, infiltrating unsuspecting circles.

000-srd_draconic_spirit.name: Draconic Spirit
000-srd_draconic_spirit.description: Appears as a translucent dragon shape.

000-srd_draft_horse.name: Draft Horse
000-srd_draft_horse.description: Though not a fighter, its powerful kick can deter attackers.

000-srd_dragon_turtle.name: Dragon Turtle
000-srd_dragon_turtle.description: Its colossal shell and steam breath lay waste to ships.

000-srd_dretch.name: Dretch
000-srd_dretch.description: Foul-smelling, snarls as it lunges in packs.

000-srd_drider.name: Drider
000-srd_drider.description: Weaves webs in the Underdark, ambushing foes with venomous strikes.

000-srd_drow.name: Drow
000-srd_drow.description: Strikes swiftly from the shadows with poisoned blade and spellcasting.

000-srd_druid.name: Druid
000-srd_druid.description: Melds with nature, casting elemental spells and transforming into beasts.

000-srd_dryad.name: Dryad
000-srd_dryad.description: Using natural illusions and ensnaring vines.

000-srd_duergar.name: Duergar
000-srd_duergar.description: Gray dwarves of the Underdark using invisibility and enlargement.

000-srd_dust_mephit.name: Dust Mephit
000-srd_dust_mephit.description: Spews choking clouds of dust and hurls stones with elemental force.

000-srd_eagle.name: Eagle
000-srd_eagle.description: A precise aerial hunter of small prey.

000-srd_earth_elemental.name: Earth Elemental
000-srd_earth_elemental.description: A towering colossus of rock and soil.

000-srd_efreeti.name: Efreeti
000-srd_efreeti.description: Born of the Elemental Plane of Fire, it commands infernos to incinerate its foes.

000-srd_elk.name: Elk
000-srd_elk.description: Though peaceful, it will defend its herd.

000-srd_erinyes.name: Erinyes
000-srd_erinyes.description: A winged divine executioner whose necrotic blade and magic rope bind foes in agony.

000-srd_ettercap.name: Ettercap
000-srd_ettercap.description: Lurks in webs, dropping with venomous fangs to ensnare prey.

000-srd_ettin.name: Ettin
000-srd_ettin.description: Smashing armor and bone with raw strength.

000-srd_fey_steed.name: Fey Steed
000-srd_fey_steed.description: A graceful, otherworldly mount born of the Feywild.

000-srd_fire_elemental.name: Fire Elemental
000-srd_fire_elemental.description: Scorching foes with fiery blasts and engulfing all in searing heat.

000-srd_fire_giant.name: Fire Giant
000-srd_fire_giant.description: Wades through molten rock, hurling blazing boulders before crushing foes with molten fists.

000-srd_flaming_sphere.name: Flaming Sphere
000-srd_flaming_sphere.description: A searing orb of fire summoned to scorch the battlefield.

000-srd_flesh_golem.name: Flesh Golem
000-srd_flesh_golem.description: Its monstrous blows and unnatural resilience make it a relentless guardian.

000-srd_floating_disk.name: Floating Disk
000-srd_floating_disk.description: Glides silently, supporting heavy burdens and moving them wherever its master commands.

000-srd_floating_whip.name: Floating Whip
000-srd_floating_whip.description: Of arcane energy it lashes out on its wielderâ€™s command, striking multiple foes with eerie precision.

000-srd_flying_snake.name: Flying Snake
000-srd_flying_snake.description: Striking with venomous fangs from above.

000-srd_frost_giant.name: Frost Giant
000-srd_frost_giant.description: Towers on icy peaks, hurling boulders of ice and crushing enemies with frost-coated weapons.

000-srd_galley.name: Galley
000-srd_galley.description: Cleaves through waves and its sturdy hull endures true storms.

000-srd_gargoyle.name: Gargoyle
000-srd_gargoyle.description: Its wings unfurling as it hurls itself at unsuspecting intruders.

000-srd_gelatinous_cube.name: Gelatinous Cube
000-srd_gelatinous_cube.description: Engulfing debris and foes alike in its transparent, acidic mass.

000-srd_ghast.name: Ghast
000-srd_ghast.description: Its foul stench and paralytic claws turning the living into fresh carrion.

000-srd_ghost.name: Ghost
000-srd_ghost.description: Drifts through walls to haunt the living. Its chilling touch drains both life and hope.

000-srd_ghoul.name: Ghoul
000-srd_ghoul.description: Feasts on decay and flesh, its claws imbued with paralytic venom.

000-srd_giant_ape.name: Giant Ape
000-srd_giant_ape.description: Rears on massive arms, hurling boulders and crushing foes with primal fury.

000-srd_giant_bat.name: Giant Bat
000-srd_giant_bat.description: Its wings span wide as it swoops silently through darkness.

000-srd_giant_centipede.name: Giant Centipede
000-srd_giant_centipede.description: Venomous bite and many (like many) legs.

000-srd_giant_constrictor_snake.name: Giant Constrictor Snake
000-srd_giant_constrictor_snake.description: Coils around its prey with bone-crushing force.

000-srd_giant_crocodile.name: Giant Crocodile
000-srd_giant_crocodile.description: Ambushing prey with powerful jaws and a thrashing tail.

000-srd_giant_eagle.name: Giant Eagle
000-srd_giant_eagle.description: Its keen eyes spotting prey before diving with lethal talons.

000-srd_giant_elk.name: Giant Elk
000-srd_giant_elk.description: Its massive antlers capable of felling foes.

000-srd_giant_fire_beetle.name: Giant Fire Beetle
000-srd_giant_fire_beetle.description: Beautiful to behold due its iridescent shell, but knows how to defend itself.

000-srd_giant_fly.name: Giant Fly
000-srd_giant_fly.description: Buzzes relentlessly, more annoying than dangerous.

000-srd_giant_goat.name: Giant Goat
000-srd_giant_goat.description: A regular ol' goat, just big.

000-srd_giant_hyena.name: Giant Hyena
000-srd_giant_hyena.description: Eerie laughter heralds the pack descending.

000-srd_giant_insect.name: Giant Insect
000-srd_giant_insect.description: Everything that's creepy and crawly and way too large for comfort.

000-srd_giant_lizard.name: Giant Lizard
000-srd_giant_lizard.description: Climbs difficult surfaces and bites if threatened, only dangerous to 1st-level Wizards.

000-srd_giant_owl.name: Giant Owl
000-srd_giant_owl.description: Glides soundlessly under moonlight, keep an eye on your Gnomes and Halflings.

000-srd_giant_rat.name: Giant Rat
000-srd_giant_rat.description: Gnaws on those spelunking in sewers.

000-srd_giant_scorpion.name: Giant Scorpion
000-srd_giant_scorpion.description: Nature's hoplite, clad in chitinous plate and wielding a lethal spear.

000-srd_giant_sea_horse.name: Giant Sea Horse
000-srd_giant_sea_horse.description: Has recently become a father. Congrats!

000-srd_giant_shark.name: Giant Shark
000-srd_giant_shark.description: Massive jaws to match massive hunger.

000-srd_giant_spider.name: Giant Spider
000-srd_giant_spider.description: Every arachnophobe's nightmare made manifest, not as threatening as the Weblurker Arachnid.

000-srd_giant_toad.name: Giant Toad
000-srd_giant_toad.description: Lurks in murky shallows and swallows prey whole.

000-srd_giant_venomous_snake.name: Giant Venomous Snake
000-srd_giant_venomous_snake.description: Lurks in hiding, strikes fast, injects venom.

000-srd_giant_vulture.name: Giant Vulture
000-srd_giant_vulture.description: Looks ominous, feasts on carcasses, a major annoyance for aspiring necromancers.

000-srd_giant_wasp.name: Giant Wasp
000-srd_giant_wasp.description: A major annoyance for picknicking giants.

000-srd_giant_weasel.name: Giant Weasel
000-srd_giant_weasel.description: Deceptively cute, only dangerous to low-level Wizards and Sorcerers.

000-srd_giant_wolf_spider.name: Giant Wolf Spider
000-srd_giant_wolf_spider.description: A fast ambusher that relies on stealth and speed. Best used for early-level encounters or as environmental hazards in fitting environments.

000-srd_gibbering_mouther.name: Gibbering Mouther
000-srd_gibbering_mouther.description: A chaotic mass of mouths and eyes disorienting all who approach.

000-srd_glabrezu.name: Glabrezu
000-srd_glabrezu.description: A powerful demon that tempts mortals with false bargains before turning to physical force.

000-srd_gladiator.name: Gladiator
000-srd_gladiator.description: Experienced arena combatant, less specialized than Retiarius, Murmillo or Dimachaerus.

000-srd_gnoll_warrior.name: Gnoll Warrior
000-srd_gnoll_warrior.description: Baseline Gnoll warrior, relatively harmless on its own, becomes exponentially more dangerous when accompanied by more powerful gnolls.

000-srd_goat.name: Goat
000-srd_goat.description: Navigates rocky slopes with ease. Screams, faints and smells weird.

000-srd_goat_of_traveling.name: Goat of Traveling
000-srd_goat_of_traveling.description: Wit sturdy hooves and uncanny endurance, it ferries travelers through treacherous mountain paths with ease.

000-srd_goblin_boss.name: Goblin Boss
000-srd_goblin_boss.description: Overworkend and in a bad mood.

000-srd_goblin_minion.name: Goblin Minion
000-srd_goblin_minion.description: Overcomes its many, many weaknesses through numbers and erratic aggression rather than individual capability.

000-srd_goblin_warrior.name: Goblin Warrior
000-srd_goblin_warrior.description: Suspiciously unwilling to divulge what exactly makes him a warrior, rather than just a minion.

000-srd_gold_dragon_wyrmling.name: Gold Dragon Wyrmling
000-srd_gold_dragon_wyrmling.description: A golden dragon cub, already exhibiting commendable valor despite its diminutive size.

000-srd_gorgon.name: Gorgon
000-srd_gorgon.description: A massive, metal-plated bull that exhales a petrifying gas.

000-srd_grasping_vine.name: Grasping Vine
000-srd_grasping_vine.description: Erupts from the ground to entangle and restrain any creature that strays too close.

000-srd_gray_ooze.name: Gray Ooze
000-srd_gray_ooze.description: Its corrosive touch and ability to split into smaller blobs can make it a surprsingly durable hazard.

000-srd_green_dragon_wyrmling.name: Green Dragon Wyrmling
000-srd_green_dragon_wyrmling.description: Cunning young dragon, already exhibiting the manipulative nature its kind is known for.

000-srd_green_hag.name: Green Hag
000-srd_green_hag.description: The basic Green Hag, less threatening than her reputation would suggest.

000-srd_grick.name: Grick
000-srd_grick.description: Worm-like ambush predator with tough hide and tentacles, capable of paralyzing unsuspecting prey.

000-srd_griffon.name: Griffon
000-srd_griffon.description: Body of a lion and the head and wings of an eagle, often used as a mount, known and feared for its speed and viciousness.

000-srd_grimlock.name: Grimlock
000-srd_grimlock.description: Blind, subterranean humanoid that relies on keen hearing and smell to hunt, often serving more powerful creatures.

000-srd_guard.name: Guard
000-srd_guard.description: Basic guard template. Best used for window dressing or as expendable mooks, not serious keepers of law and order.

000-srd_guard_captain.name: Guard Captain
000-srd_guard_captain.description: Slightly more capable than the average guardsman, however not as strategically adept as the Tactician or City Guard Captain.

000-srd_guardian_naga.name: Guardian Naga
000-srd_guardian_naga.description: serpentine celestial with healing and spellcasting abilities, can often be found protecting sacred places or ancient relics.

000-srd_guardian_of_faith.name: Guardian of Faith
000-srd_guardian_of_faith.description: Manifests from radiant light, using holy magic to shield allies from harm.

000-srd_gynosphinx.name: Gynosphinx
000-srd_gynosphinx.description: Regal, winged lioness with humanoid features. Known to guard ancient secrets or treasures with sharp wit and powerful magic.

000-srd_half_dragon.name: Half Dragon
000-srd_half_dragon.description: Combines humanoid cunning with draconic might.

000-srd_half_red_dragon_veteran.name: Half Red Dragon Veteran
000-srd_half_red_dragon_veteran.description: Veteran warrior whose martial skills are enhanced by draconic abilities.

000-srd_harpy.name: Harpy
000-srd_harpy.description: A flying humanoid, often depicted female, that uses a magical song to lure victims to their doom.

000-srd_hawk.name: Hawk
000-srd_hawk.description: Agile bird of prey often used for scouting or hunting small prey.

000-srd_hell_hound.name: Hell Hound
000-srd_hell_hound.description: Fiery breathing canine, often employed as beasts of war due to their aggressive nature. Still good boys, just by different standards.

000-srd_hezrou.name: Hezrou
000-srd_hezrou.description: A large, toad-like demon that exudes a nauseating stench.

000-srd_hill_giant.name: Hill Giant
000-srd_hill_giant.description: A dim-witted and vulgar, yet physically imposing giant that relies on raw power and brute force, often using rocks or trees as weapons.

000-srd_hippogriff.name: Hippogriff
000-srd_hippogriff.description: Combines traits of eagle and horse, can be feral predator or loyal mount.

000-srd_hippopotamus.name: Hippopotamus
000-srd_hippopotamus.description: A tough animal with strong jaws and surprising speed, dangerous both in water and on land.

000-srd_hobgoblin_captain.name: Hobgoblin Captain
000-srd_hobgoblin_captain.description: More capable than the average Hobgoblin Warrior, granting nearby allies advantage on their melee attacks.

000-srd_hobgoblin_warrior.name: Hobgoblin Warrior
000-srd_hobgoblin_warrior.description: A disciplined, martial humanoid that fights in organized units, benefiting from group tactics and dealing extra damage when allies are nearby

000-srd_homunculus.name: Homunculus
000-srd_homunculus.description: Created by a spellcaster to serve as a familiar, offering limited intelligence, telepathic communication, and basic utility in scouting or delivering spells.

000-srd_horned_devil.name: Horned Devil
000-srd_horned_devil.description: Reasonable powerful and able to fly. Impressive melee damage output qualifies it as a disciplined enforcer in the infernal hierarchy.

000-srd_huge_animated_object.name: Huge Animated Object
000-srd_huge_animated_object.description: A huge object bestowed with a semblance of life.

000-srd_hunter_shark.name: Hunter Shark
000-srd_hunter_shark.description: Agile hunter, can be found circling ships, scavenging for scraps, both living or dead.

000-srd_hydra.name: Hydra
000-srd_hydra.description: A relentless foe. Severed heads grow back swiftly, its overwhelmed prey eventually succumbing to poison and fatigue.

000-srd_hyena.name: Hyena
000-srd_hyena.description: Scavenger beast roaming in packs, feared due do its unnvering, humanoid cry-laughter.

000-srd_ice_devil.name: Ice Devil
000-srd_ice_devil.description: Insectoid devil wielding otherworldly frost as its weapon.

000-srd_ice_mephit.name: Ice Mephit
000-srd_ice_mephit.description: Minor elemental able to slow and freeze enemies.

000-srd_illusory_creature.name: Illusory Creature
000-srd_illusory_creature.description: Flickers between reality and deception, confusing foes.

000-srd_illusory_object.name: Illusory Object
000-srd_illusory_object.description: A phantom replica of a mundane item.

000-srd_illusory_phenomenon.name: Illusory Phenomenon
000-srd_illusory_phenomenon.description: A shifting mirage of sound and light that confounds the senses.

000-srd_imp.name: Imp
000-srd_imp.description: Devious minor fiend adept at sowing chaos.

000-srd_incubus.name: Incubus
000-srd_incubus.description: A seductive fiend excelling at using its guile to manipulate mortals.

000-srd_invisible_sensor.name: Invisible Sensor
000-srd_invisible_sensor.description: A magical sensor planted for surveillance and reconnaissance.

000-srd_invisible_stalker.name: Invisible Stalker
000-srd_invisible_stalker.description: Invisible air elemental feared for its sudden, silent ambushes.

000-srd_iron_golem.name: Iron Golem
000-srd_iron_golem.description: Powerful construct crafted from heavy iron, boasting terrifying offensive and defensive capabilities.

000-srd_jackal.name: Jackal
000-srd_jackal.description: Stalks desertes and wastelands for prey, usually only dangerous to humans when starving or provoked.

000-srd_keelboat.name: Keelboat
000-srd_keelboat.description: Comparatively small boat, yet still capable of carrying a full party and then some.

000-srd_killer_whale.name: Killer Whale
000-srd_killer_whale.description: The largest and deadliest dolphin, unnervingly intelligent and often with a sadistic streak.

000-srd_knight.name: Knight
000-srd_knight.description: Equipped with plate armor and a greatsword, this standard knight template makes for a passable melee threat.

000-srd_kobold_warrior.name: Kobold Warrior
000-srd_kobold_warrior.description: Traditionally serving draconic masters, most Kobolds live short and hectic lifes.

000-srd_kraken.name: Kraken
000-srd_kraken.description: A sea monster of mythical proportions, capable of trashing ships and seasoned parties with ease.

000-srd_lamia.name: Lamia
000-srd_lamia.description: Half human, half lion with a cruel streak, capable of insidious magic.

000-srd_large_animated_object.name: Large Animated Object
000-srd_large_animated_object.description: A large object imbued with a semblance of life.

000-srd_lemure.name: Lemure
000-srd_lemure.description: A mindless, writhing mass of flesh, forming the lowest form of devil in the Nine Hells.

000-srd_lich.name: Lich
000-srd_lich.description: Overcame death by sealing part of its soul away, usually has legions of undead unter its thrall.

000-srd_lizardfolk.name: Lizardfolk
000-srd_lizardfolk.description: Inhabiting dense jungles, defending their sacred lands with repitilian ferocity.

000-srd_longship.name: Longship
000-srd_longship.description: A sleek, shallow-draft, oar-and-sail-powered vessel designed for swift incursions upstream and coastal raiding (casual and professional).

000-srd_mage.name: Mage
000-srd_mage.description: Capable of casting low- to mid-level spells.

000-srd_mage_hand.name: Mage Hand
000-srd_mage_hand.description: An ethereal hand, capable of performing small tasks on command.

000-srd_magma_mephit.name: Magma Mephit
000-srd_magma_mephit.description: A minor elemental, primarily utilized due to its ability to burst into a splash of lava upon death.

000-srd_magmin.name: Magmin
000-srd_magmin.description: Small fire elemental appreciated for its ability and willingness to explode.

000-srd_mammoth.name: Mammoth
000-srd_mammoth.description: Traversing the tundra in herds, terrifying when provoked.

000-srd_manticore.name: Manticore
000-srd_manticore.description: A winged lion with a twisted, human face whose tail fires off poisonous spikes.

000-srd_marilith.name: Marilith
000-srd_marilith.description: A six-armed serpent-demon armed with an equal amount of pact-powered blades.

000-srd_mastiff.name: Mastiff
000-srd_mastiff.description: A sturdy dog well-equipped for the needs of seasoned adventurers.

000-srd_medium_animated_object.name: Medium Animated Object
000-srd_medium_animated_object.description: A medium-sized object imbued with a semblance of life.

000-srd_medusa.name: Medusa
000-srd_medusa.description: Snake-haired humanoid with a petrifying gaze, oftentimes target of crass jokes.

000-srd_merrow.name: Merrow
000-srd_merrow.description: Belligerent denizens of the high seas, often accompanied by various sharks.

000-srd_mimic.name: Mimic
000-srd_mimic.description: Shapechanging monstrosity camouflaging itself as a regular treasure chest.

000-srd_minotaur.name: Minotaur
000-srd_minotaur.description: Its massive horns and brutish strength crushing foes in deadly charges.

000-srd_minotaur_of_baphomet.name: Minotaur of Baphomet
000-srd_minotaur_of_baphomet.description: Chosen by its demomic patron, this Minotaur boasts a slighty greater challenge than a regular one.

000-srd_minotaur_skeleton.name: Minotaur Skeleton
000-srd_minotaur_skeleton.description: The skeletal remains of a Minotaur, still able and willing to fight.

000-srd_mummy.name: Mummy
000-srd_mummy.description: Shambling undead that haunt derelict tombs, catacombs and necropoleis.

000-srd_mummy_lord.name: Mummy Lord
000-srd_mummy_lord.description: Embalmed, entombed and loving it. Lords over your average mummies, but does not pack the punch of a Lord of Dust.

000-srd_nalfeshnee.name: Nalfeshnee
000-srd_nalfeshnee.description: A demnonic brute capable of rending flesh and warping minds.

000-srd_night_hag.name: Night Hag
000-srd_night_hag.description: An illustrious hag who keeps herself busy with invading dreams and stealing souls.

000-srd_nightmare.name: Nightmare
000-srd_nightmare.description: A burning steed, often bestowed upon those who have friends in infernal places.

000-srd_noble.name: Noble
000-srd_noble.description: Represents a baseline humanoid noble. Once its stat block becomes relevant, it probably won't live long.

000-srd_nothic.name: Nothic
000-srd_nothic.description: With a single unblinking eye, it peers into minds to steal secrets and sow paranoia.

000-srd_ochre_jelly.name: Ochre Jelly
000-srd_ochre_jelly.description: Dissolves flesh and metal upon contact, growing larger with each devoured foe. When struck, it fragments into smaller jellies, multiplying the threat.

000-srd_octopus.name: Octopus
000-srd_octopus.description: Eight arms, full of ink, surprisingly clever.

000-srd_ogre.name: Ogre
000-srd_ogre.description: Large, lumbering humanoid with barely enough brawn to justify its lack of brains.

000-srd_ogre_zombie.name: Ogre Zombie
000-srd_ogre_zombie.description: Smells only slightly worse than a living ogre.

000-srd_oni.name: Oni
000-srd_oni.description: Weaves illusions to terrify its foes. Its rapid regeneration makes it a relentless adversary.

000-srd_otherworldly_steed.name: Otherworldly Steed
000-srd_otherworldly_steed.description: A horse but, like, from another world.

000-srd_otyugh.name: Otyugh
000-srd_otyugh.description: An ungly mass of threshing tentacles and toothy maws.

000-srd_owlbear.name: Owlbear
000-srd_owlbear.description: Unnerving, yet beloved amalgamation of owl and bear.

000-srd_panther.name: Panther
000-srd_panther.description: I see a leopard/jaguar and I want to paint it black.

000-srd_pegasus.name: Pegasus
000-srd_pegasus.description: Serving as a noble mount and valiant ally for riders it deems worthy.

000-srd_phantom_steed.name: Phantom Steed
000-srd_phantom_steed.description: Stoically carries its rider across realms.

000-srd_phase_spider.name: Phase Spider
000-srd_phase_spider.description: Blinks between the Ethereal and Material planes to ambush prey.

000-srd_piranha.name: Piranha
000-srd_piranha.description: Less of a threat than your childhood fears made them out to be.

000-srd_pit_fiend.name: Pit Fiend
000-srd_pit_fiend.description: Its whip and claws tearing souls as it commands legions of devils.

000-srd_planetar.name: Planetar
000-srd_planetar.description: A celestial warrior clad in radiant armor, wielding divine magic and a flaming sword to smite evil.

000-srd_polar_bear.name: Polar Bear
000-srd_polar_bear.description: A hulking predator of the frozen lands.

000-srd_pony.name: Pony
000-srd_pony.description: A sturdy pony carries riders and burdens with sure-footed grace.

000-srd_priest_acolyte.name: Priest Acolyte
000-srd_priest_acolyte.description: A devoted priest acolyte chants healing prayers and minor divine spells to bolster allies.

000-srd_pseudodragon.name: Pseudodragon
000-srd_pseudodragon.description: A diminutive dragon with iridescent scales and mischievous intelligence.

000-srd_purple_worm.name: Purple Worm
000-srd_purple_worm.description: A colossal burrowing horror with a venomous stinger that swallows prey whole and melts them in acid.

000-srd_quasit.name: Quasit
000-srd_quasit.description: Shifts between forms to deceive and harry foes.

000-srd_quipper.name: Quipper
000-srd_quipper.description: Its razor teeth nipping at swimmers and small fish with sudden ferocity.

000-srd_rakshasa.name: Rakshasa
000-srd_rakshasa.description: Conceals its true form behind illusions and hexing spells, reveling in manipulation and terror.

000-srd_raven.name: Raven
000-srd_raven.description: Though small, its appearance often foretells omens or guides mages.

000-srd_red_dragon_wyrmling.name: Red Dragon Wyrmling
000-srd_red_dragon_wyrmling.description: A hot-tempered hatchling with fire breath and burning ambition.

000-srd_remorhaz.name: Remorhaz
000-srd_remorhaz.description: Its blazing carapace melts snow and scorches flesh with unrelenting fury.

000-srd_rhinoceros.name: Rhinoceros
000-srd_rhinoceros.description: Its horn goring foes with brutal precision.

000-srd_roc.name: Roc
000-srd_roc.description: A colossal predator dives down, carrying victims aloft before dropping them.

000-srd_roper.name: Roper
000-srd_roper.description: Ensnaring prey with sinewy tendrils. Once trapped, victims are drawn inexorably to its gaping maw.

000-srd_rust_monster.name: Rust Monster
000-srd_rust_monster.description: Its antennae corroding armor and weapons on contact.

000-srd_saber_toothed_tiger.name: Saber Toothed Tiger
000-srd_saber_toothed_tiger.description: Ambushing prey in a flash of predatory fury.

000-srd_sahuagin_warrior.name: Sahuagin Warrior
000-srd_sahuagin_warrior.description: Strikes with trident and claw in coordinated packs beneath reef walls.

000-srd_salamander.name: Salamander
000-srd_salamander.description: Its burning blade and fiery touch scorching any who dare approach.

000-srd_satyr.name: Satyr
000-srd_satyr.description: Dances through forest glades, playing haunting tunes that charm and confuse.

000-srd_scout.name: Scout
000-srd_scout.description: Moves silently ahead of its allies.

000-srd_sea_hag.name: Sea Hag
000-srd_sea_hag.description: A sinister aquatic illusionist who frightens with a glance and kills with a glare

000-srd_sea_horse.name: Sea Horse
000-srd_sea_horse.description: Its curled tail can whip foes.

000-srd_shambling_mound.name: Shambling Mound
000-srd_shambling_mound.description: Engulfs targets in suffocating vines and regenerates on lightning damage.

000-srd_shield_guardian.name: Shield Guardian
000-srd_shield_guardian.description: Stands vigil, its rune-inscribed form absorbing blows as it protects its master with unyielding loyalty.

000-srd_shrieker_fungus.name: Shrieker Fungus
000-srd_shrieker_fungus.description: Emits a piercing screech when disturbed, alerting nearby creatures to intruders with its eerie alarm.

000-srd_silver_dragon_wyrmling.name: Silver Dragon Wyrmling
000-srd_silver_dragon_wyrmling.description: A gentle frostling with icy breath and unwavering loyalty.

000-srd_skeleton.name: Skeleton
000-srd_skeleton.description: A reanimated husk wielding rusted weapons.

000-srd_slaad_tadpole.name: Slaad Tadpole
000-srd_slaad_tadpole.description: A writhing tadpole of chaotic power, it burrows into hosts to spawn horrific offspring.

000-srd_small_animated_object.name: Small Animated Object
000-srd_small_animated_object.description: Skitters and strikes with unexpected force, following its creatorâ€™s will in silent precision.

000-srd_solar.name: Solar
000-srd_solar.description: Descends from the heavens, its radiant blade and holy magic banishing evil. Its legendary might and inspiring aura rally allies and shatter darkness.

000-srd_specter.name: Specter
000-srd_specter.description: Draining vitality with a touch of icy dread.

000-srd_sphinx_of_wonder.name: Sphinx of Wonder
000-srd_sphinx_of_wonder.description: Weaves illusions and puzzles before striking with lethal claws.

000-srd_spider.name: Spider
000-srd_spider.description: A common spider, itsy as well as bitsy.

000-srd_spirit_naga.name: Spirit Naga
000-srd_spirit_naga.description: Weaving powerful spells and ensnaring minds.

000-srd_spiritual_weapon.name: Spiritual Weapon
000-srd_spiritual_weapon.description: A spectral weapon of divine force.

000-srd_sprite.name: Sprite
000-srd_sprite.description: Invisible fey, firing mind altering arrows.

000-srd_steam_mephit.name: Steam Mephit
000-srd_steam_mephit.description: Hurls scalding steam jets and hisses with corrosive scorn.

000-srd_stirge.name: Stirge
000-srd_stirge.description: A tiny, blood-sucking insect the size of a cat.

000-srd_stone_giant.name: Stone Giant
000-srd_stone_giant.description: Hurls massive boulders before crushing foes with its club.

000-srd_stone_golem.name: Stone Golem
000-srd_stone_golem.description: A hulking construct of living rock.

000-srd_storm_giant.name: Storm Giant
000-srd_storm_giant.description: Commands thunder and tidal fury, hurling lightning bolts and massive stones with divine wrath.

000-srd_succubus.name: Succubus
000-srd_succubus.description: Weaves seductive magic and shadowy allure, draining wills and striking with demonic claws in wicked delight.

000-srd_swarm_of_beetles.name: Swarm of Beetles
000-srd_swarm_of_beetles.description: A writhing horde of ravenous beetles.

000-srd_swarm_of_centipedes.name: Swarm of Centipedes
000-srd_swarm_of_centipedes.description: A writhing swarm of giant centipedes.

000-srd_swarm_of_crawling_claws.name: Swarm of Crawling Claws
000-srd_swarm_of_crawling_claws.description: A writhing wave of disembodied hands.

000-srd_swarm_of_piranhas.name: Swarm of Piranhas
000-srd_swarm_of_piranhas.description: A swirling mass of razor-toothed piranhas.

000-srd_swarm_of_quippers.name: Swarm of Quippers
000-srd_swarm_of_quippers.description: A frenzied school of razor-toothed fish.

000-srd_swarm_of_ravens.name: Swarm of Ravens
000-srd_swarm_of_ravens.description: A flapping swarm of ravens darkens the sky.

000-srd_swarm_of_spiders.name: Swarm of Spiders
000-srd_swarm_of_spiders.description: A writhing tide of arachnid legs.

000-srd_swarm_of_venomous_snakes.name: Swarm of Venomous Snakes
000-srd_swarm_of_venomous_snakes.description: A writhing swarm of venomous snakes thrashes in unison.

000-srd_swarm_of_wasps.name: Swarm of Wasps
000-srd_swarm_of_wasps.description: A buzzing swarm of wasps darts relentlessly, stinging foes with painful venom.

000-srd_tarrasque.name: Tarrasque
000-srd_tarrasque.description: A world-devouring behemoth, the Tarrasque awakens to lay waste with unstoppable force.

000-srd_thug.name: Thug
000-srd_thug.description: Menaces with crude blade and harsh threats, relying on brute force rather than finesse to subdue foes.

000-srd_tiger.name: Tiger
000-srd_tiger.description: A sleek, striped predator stalks its prey.

000-srd_tiny_animated_object.name: Tiny Animated Object
000-srd_tiny_animated_object.description: A small arcane construct that hops and flails, seeking to trip and distract its foes.

000-srd_tough.name: Tough
000-srd_tough.description: A relentless bruiser who fights in formation.

000-srd_tough_boss.name: Tough Boss
000-srd_tough_boss.description: A relentless bruiser who fights in formation, knocking enemies back with brute force.

000-srd_treant.name: Treant
000-srd_treant.description: Strides through ancient forests, lashing branches to crush intruders and calling roots to entangle unwelcome guests.

000-srd_tribal_warrior.name: Tribal Warrior
000-srd_tribal_warrior.description: Their pack tactics and brutal strikes make them fierce front-line combatants.

000-srd_troll.name: Troll
000-srd_troll.description: Its voracious hunger matched only by its uncanny healing.

000-srd_troll_limb.name: Troll Limb
000-srd_troll_limb.description: crushing or ensnaring those it touches.

000-srd_tyrannosaurus_rex.name: Tyrannosaurus Rex
000-srd_tyrannosaurus_rex.description: Crushing bone as it charges with unstoppable force.

000-srd_unicorn.name: Unicorn
000-srd_unicorn.description: Gallops with silvery grace through moonlit glades.

000-srd_unseen_servant.name: Unseen Servant
000-srd_unseen_servant.description: An invisible, mindless force obeys simple commands.

000-srd_vampire.name: Vampire
000-srd_vampire.description: Drains life and turning victims into thralls.

000-srd_vampire_familiar.name: Vampire Familiar
000-srd_vampire_familiar.description: Serves its vampire master as both spy and predator.

000-srd_vampire_spawn.name: Vampire Spawn
000-srd_vampire_spawn.description: Grapples, Slash throats and drains life.

000-srd_venomous_snake.name: Venomous Snake
000-srd_venomous_snake.description: Strikes from hidden cover, delivering paralytic poison before slithering back into dense underbrush.

000-srd_vrock.name: Vrock
000-srd_vrock.description: Spirals down from the sky, raining toxic spores before tearing enemies with bladed wings.

000-srd_vulture.name: Vulture
000-srd_vulture.description: It swoops in for tearing strikes with razor talons.

000-srd_warhorse.name: Warhorse
000-srd_warhorse.description: Charges into battle with thunderous hooves.

000-srd_warhorse_skeleton.name: Warhorse Skeleton
000-srd_warhorse_skeleton.description: Its exposed bones rattling as it carries undead riders into battle.

000-srd_warrior_infantry.name: Warrior Infantry
000-srd_warrior_infantry.description: A disciplined infantry soldier marches in formation.

000-srd_warrior_veteran.name: Warrior Veteran
000-srd_warrior_veteran.description: Breaking enemy lines with disciplined strikes.

000-srd_warship.name: Warship
000-srd_warship.description: Its decks teem with soldiers ready to board enemy vessels.

000-srd_water_elemental.name: Water Elemental
000-srd_water_elemental.description: A twisting whirl of water formed by magic.

000-srd_werebear.name: Werebear
000-srd_werebear.description: Shapeshifter. Massive claws rending foes and its thick fur shrugging off harm.

000-srd_wererat.name: Wererat
000-srd_wererat.description: Shapeshifter. Stealthy assaults and savage claws.

000-srd_weretiger.name: Weretiger
000-srd_weretiger.description: Shapeshifter. Its lightning-fast strikes and primal ferocity make it a deadly predator.

000-srd_werewolf.name: Werewolf
000-srd_werewolf.description: Shapeshifter. Its ferocity it a relentless nocturnal predator.

000-srd_white_dragon_wyrmling.name: White Dragon Wyrmling
000-srd_white_dragon_wyrmling.description: A feral frostspawn with chilling breath and primal hunger.

000-srd_wight.name: Wight
000-srd_wight.description: Its presence raises fallen foes to fight alongside it.

000-srd_will_o_wisp.name: Will o Wisp
000-srd_will_o_wisp.description: A will-o'-wisp glows to lure wanderers into traps before striking with arcane shock.

000-srd_winter_wolf.name: Winter Wolf
000-srd_winter_wolf.description: Its haunting howls signal the approach of the pack.

000-srd_wolf.name: Wolf
000-srd_wolf.description: A relentless hunger, it hunts in packs.

000-srd_worg.name: Worg
000-srd_worg.description: Charging with savage ferocity alongside goblinoid riders.

000-srd_wyvern.name: Wyvern
000-srd_wyvern.description: Soars on leathery wings, striking with venomous stinger.

000-srd_xorn.name: Xorn
000-srd_xorn.description: A rocky elemental tunneler, it devours metals and stone and claws through earth.

000-srd_young_black_dragon.name: Young Black Dragon
000-srd_young_black_dragon.description: A stealthy terror lurking in murky swamps, striking with corrosive fury.

000-srd_young_blue_dragon.name: Young Blue Dragon
000-srd_young_blue_dragon.description: A storm-charged predator stalking Wastelands with deadly precision.

000-srd_young_brass_dragon.name: Young Brass Dragon
000-srd_young_brass_dragon.description: â€™s gleaming scales reflect desert sun as it breathes scalding acid and engages foes with playful taunts. Its curiosity makes it as unpredictable as it is dangerous.

000-srd_young_bronze_dragon.name: Young Bronze Dragon
000-srd_young_bronze_dragon.description: A vigilant protector striking with thunder and confusion.

000-srd_young_copper_dragon.name: Young Copper Dragon
000-srd_young_copper_dragon.description: A quick-witted ambusher blending laughter with corrosive power.

000-srd_young_gold_dragon.name: Young Gold Dragon
