000-srd_young_gold_dragon.description: A radiant flameborn cub, small yet noble and fiercely protective.

000-srd_young_green_dragon.name: Young Green Dragon
000-srd_young_green_dragon.description: A manipulative predator hiding among trees, exhaling poisonous doom.

000-srd_young_red_dragon.name: Young Red Dragon
000-srd_young_red_dragon.description: A greedy flame-winged terror scorching mountains and claiming all.

000-srd_young_silver_dragon.name: Young Silver Dragon
000-srd_young_silver_dragon.description: A noble guardian gliding through snow, freezing foes with conviction.

000-srd_young_white_dragon.name: Young White Dragon
000-srd_young_white_dragon.description: A savage glacier-stalking beast with icy fury.

000-srd_zombie.name: Zombie
000-srd_zombie.description: Its undead form shrugging off harm while pursuing the living with mindless hunger.

001-primal_vampire_spawn.description: Sometimes Vampires impart the dubious gift of spawndom upon the wrong soul, stirring primordial horrors from their sleep. These vampire spawns regress to a primal state, detached from the rules that even compel their creators, driven only by their lust for terror and agony.  Primal Spawns are beyond their unwilling creators' control and they in turn feel disdain for their more ‘evolved’ kin. Despite not having a weakness to sunlight, they prefer the shadows, as the darkness supports their preferred hunting style. And if the right opportunity arises, a Primal Vampire Spawn will not hesitate to hunt during broad daylight to indulge in the screams of horrified onlookers.
001-primal_vampire_spawn.name: Primal Vampire Spawn

002-gluttony.description: This creature is the embodiment of self indulgence, the nature-given love and need for sustenance perverted and twisted into a bloated creature of repulsive proportions. Gluttony poisons mind and body in equal measure and hungers endlessly, existing for the singular purpose to make everything in existence one with itself.
002-gluttony.name: Gluttony

003-inquisitorial_penitent.description: Inquisitorial Penitents are former witches, persecuted and excruciatingly converted by those they now serve as living weapons. Their connection to the arcane has been perverted, the flow of magic reversed, as they now syphon arcane energies from others with their mere presence. They stalk the lands in packs, travel as independent operatives or are part of an inquisitorial retinue, acting as both bodyguards and executioners. The most dangerous penitents, however, are those who underwent the purifications voluntarily, eager to shed the taint of witchcraft. They are the most unforgiving and zealous of their kind, hunting their tainted kin without mercy or remorse.
003-inquisitorial_penitent.name: Inquisitorial Penitent

004-curseweaver.description: Curseweavers are sinister creatures exhibiting a perverse interest in the political dealings of mortal beings.
004-curseweaver.name: Curse Weaver

005-assassin.description: If one seeks to end a life, one does not necessarily have to get their hands dirty. There are professionals trained in the art of killing, who are eager to be of service - either to earn some coin, further a dark agenda or for personal pleasure. The play of murder has thousands of scripts and props, but a knife in the dark remains an all time classic.
005-assassin.name: Novice Assassin

006-shield_guardian.description: Exposure to extreme instances of magnetism might cause an as of yet unexplained transformation within Shield Guardians.The docile automatons undergo a rapid evolution, triggering both a physical transformation and a severe change in behaviour. A Polarized Shield Guardian is no longer bound to its master, resisting any attempt of external control with violent means. Their physique adapts to support a construct now geared towards offensive conflict resolution, rather than silent endurance. These creatures are exceedingly rare and, if able to break their shackles for good, wander the lands guided by their mysterious connection to both magical and magnetic forces.
006-shield_guardian.name: Polarized Shield Guardian

007-umber_spinner.description: Umber Hulks spend their youthful days terrorising the Underdark or similar subterranean spaces. In this harsh environment, few survive long enough to see their powerful frame diminish with age, shedding the recognizable heavy chitinous plating and finally sprouting wings and a wicked stinger. On buzzing wings the now pubescent Umber Spinners set out, seeking weakened or isolated humanoids in their mission to preserve the dominion of their kind...
007-umber_spinner.name: Umber Spinner

008-gluttonys_aspect.description: Dull-looking, dimwitted and bloated creatures, filled to the brim with noxious gas and disgusting thoughts. They nest within the fleshy crevasses of Gluttony's lumpy body and swarm out on its command, eager to gather offerings to gain their master's favour.
008-gluttonys_aspect.name: Gluttony's Aspect

009-skeleton_henchman.description: If you are interested in exercising cross-regional influence and could not care less about your image,  Skeleton Henchmen are the ideal lynchpin for your entourage. They are loyal, cheap and, if you know your way around the local cemetery, rather easy to aquire. The basic Skeleton Henchman is a great foundation to expand upon, as they are highly customizable and require minimal upkeep and maintenance. Guard duty, law enforcement or warfare, Skeleton Henchmen provide satisfactory service in diverse work environments.
009-skeleton_henchman.name: Skeleton Henchman

010-horse.description: Horses are half a ton worth of muscle crammed into an elegant and timeless frame. They are fast, they are not particularly intelligent and they are an essential component of the fantasy genre. In the context of adventuring, Horses are mainly used for travel and battle, although they may as well become trusted and loved companions to the players. This reimagination of the classic Horse embodies a sturdy and valiant creature able to support it's party on arduous voyages as well as dire combat scenarios.
010-horse.name: Horse

011-trained_fighter.description: War veterans, gang members with military experience or nobles who spent a fair share of their youth under the watchful eyes of combat instructors - the Trained Fighter represents all of them and more. They are trained in the art of Melee, have seen various combat scenarios and lived to tell the tale. While a rabble of peasants or a gang of highwaymen can be disposed of rather quickly and with little effort, an organized troop of Trained Fighters makes for a varitable fighting force, leading to a complex and tactical encounter for a low or even mid-level party.
011-trained_fighter.name: Trained Fighter

012-cipactli.description: Cipactli are the alleged offspring of a reptilian river god feared for his boundless rage. They roam mangrove forests and tropical river banks in packs, behaving very territorial and highly aggressive towards any kind of encroachment. Their social behaviour is suprisingly complex, with them displaying their martial skills through ritualized combat among each other. However, if isolated from its pack, a Cipactli can form an equally strong bond with any creature able to gain the Cipactli's respect by demonstrating superior prowess. Indigenous tribes have been observed utilizing bonded Cipactli as status symbols, as well as beasts of burden or instruments of war. Tribal legends tell of champions riding into battle mounted on a rampaging Cipactli, battering aside enemies and jungle trees alike in a display of rage worthy of their eponymous genitor.
012-cipactli.name: Cipactli

013-harpyia.description: Not many a  creature is as unjustly feared and detested as the Harpyia. Decried as carriers of bad omen, death and evil magic, they have been hunted to near extinction. The remaining Harpyies prefer to nest on storm-wreathed cliffsides and within coastal ravines, seeking safety in isolation. Legend has them born from wind and water, which might explain their affinity to the sea. Colonies, or *parliaments*, of Harpyies can be often found nesting atop the salt-encrusted masts and rigging of beached shipwrecks. This behaviour unfortunately further feeds the hate and fear towards them, as they stand accused of gloating over the misfortune of others, when in reality Harpyies are inclined to protect shipwrecked sailors from actual malicious creatures like the alluring Sirens.
013-harpyia.name: Harpyia

014-dragon.description: The Dragon might be the ultimate mythical creature. Almost every human culture has a being with the shared traits of a snake-like body, mighty wings, supernatural cunning and indomitable might. In some myths and folktales they are benevolent and wise, in most they are cruel and despotic. Our dragon makes no attempt at being an ambivalent creature, skirting the border of good and evil or trying to paint the picture of a complex and often misunderstood creature. This dragon is a scaled tyrant, a megalomaniacal lizard corrupted by the arcane energies flowing through its veins. It is avaricious, gluttonous, wrathful and treacherous - the worst traits humanity can offer, but enabled by inhabiting a body of a living and breathing natural disaster.
014-dragon.name: Dragon

015-werewolf.description: The Wulfen Curse is an affliction of the soul. Some humanoids already carry the seed of beasthood with them, nurturing a dark hunger for violence and bloodshed. If they give in to this hunger, the dread curse takes hold, shaping the body in accordance to the soul. Over time the Wulfen comes to detest its humanoid body, the metaphysical affliction of the soul mirrored in the physical realm. They are, however, forever trapped between worlds, for they are neither wolf nor man, but a chimeric soul burdened with an appetite for both the chase and the catch.
015-werewolf.name: Werewolf

016-wolf.description: Wolves are natures way of reminding humans that their superiority extends only as far as their city walls. Those who still venture forth into the frontiers are wise to fear the wolf, the grey-haired and yellow-eyed incarnation of the hunt. Many tribal cultures worship the wolf as totem animals, venerating them as bringers of swift death and cunning hunters, as well as symbols of unity and cohesion.
016-wolf.name: Wolf

016-wolfkin.description: Those afflicted by the Curse of the Wulfen slowly lose themselves to the bestial urges festering within their soul. After each hunt it gets harder to take on human form and even the horrid shape of the man-wolf becomes difficult to maintain. Soon the Wolfkin have all but forgotten what it means to be human and fully dedicate themselves to the hunt. Bigger, stronger and blessed with a remaining spark of malicious intellect, Wolfkin soon find themselves in charge of a pack of regular wolves, often answering the call of other hunting Wulfen, eager to redden their maw in the ensuing bloodbath.
016-wolfkin.name: Wolfkin

017-dwarven_king.description: Dwarven Kings do not rule by birthright alone, but command respect earned by dilligence, grit and merit. Dwarves are a proud and stubborn folk and while they appreciate the rigid structures of monarchy, they need a reason for why a specific individual should hold the power to rule the grand cave cities, vast mountain halls and stalwart hill fortresses of dwarvenkind. However, if an aspirant to the throne manages to endure the ordeals and rites necessary to claim the title of king, their subjects serve them with unwavering loyalty. Each Dwarven King is a statesman, general and master craftsman with a body of granite, a soul of iron and a heart of gold.
017-dwarven_king.name: Dwarven King

018-giant_spider.description: Based on your disposition towards spiders in general, a confrontation with Megaarachnids can range from unpleasant to traumatising. They are vicious predators who are dangerous when you see them, as they can unexpectedly cross surprising distances with mighty leaps, but infinitively more dangerous if you don't, as they excel at lurking in the shadows while waiting in their web, eager to strike as their prey becomes more and more entangled. Megaarachnids usually hunt alone or in small packs to take down bigger prey, but are also known to band together in vast colonies, occupying claustrophobic burrows or abandoned structures, creating a web-covered and egg-filled nightmare realm littered with the dried out husks of their victims.
018-giant_spider.name: Weblurker Arachnid

019-reef_keeper.description: Reef Keepers manifest around hydrothermal vents and venture the sea bed in search of untouched subnautic ecosystems like lush coral reefs or kelp forests, where they guard the native lifeforms against invasive species or destructive unnatural forces. Their true form is hard to discern, as they are overgrown with a thick crust of mineral-rich sediment. This crust acts both as natural armor, as well as a rich source of nutrients for nearby flora and fauna. Reef Keepers are usually docile, but if they consider their chosen protectorate endangered they make use of a vast arsenal of exotic defensive capabilities
019-reef_keeper.name: Reef Keeper

020-grimgheist.description: Grimgheists are soul-constructs fashioned from murderous and vengeful souls by particularly ruthless practicers of dark and forbidden arts. Driven by an innate thirst for murder and furtherly incited by their creators, the Grimgheist are tasked to either haunt a specific target or to just wreak havoc among the enemies of its master. As they can effortlessly travel between the profane and the ethereal world, they make for efficient assassins, being able to materialize infront of their hapless target and unleash horrible acts of violence upon it, fueled by pure hatred for the living.
020-grimgheist.name: Grimgheist

021-ghoul_wretchling.description: The scratching and scrawling noises of Ghoul Wretchlings in the walls and under the floor boards herald an incoming Ghoul Invasion. In the following nights people disappear from the streets or the safety of their homes, overwhelmed and paralyzed by  swarms of the scrawny Ghoul Wretchlings, before being dragged to the underground lairs as nourishment for the advancing main force of Ghoulish invaders.
021-ghoul_wretchling.name: Ghoul Wretchling

022-orc_shaman.description: Shamans are the spiritual leaders of an orc warhost. They maintain the moral of the troops by conducting bonding rituals and are generally tasked with a wide array of ceremonial duties. Even though they are feared and respected, Shamans often are outsiders, as their reclusive nature and connection to the spiritual world warps them into capricious eccentrics. Most Shamans are not bound to any host, as their true loyalty lies with the shamanistic covens they belong to, often only supporting a host chief when their reign of terror furthers the Shamans own, often concealed, agenda. In combat, Shamans are fearsome opponents who may call upon forces of nature to bring their enemies to their knees. They are able to call upon aid from beyond the Graves and inspire the troops surrounding them to fight even harder, as they feel their ancestor's gaze upon them.
022-orc_shaman.name: Orc Shaman

023-orc_warchief.description: The Warchief is the single greatest authority within the ranks of a war host - an inspiring, or at least intimidating, leader, a successful commander and a powerful warrior. If they set foot onto a battlefield, their troops throw themselves every more recklessly at the enemy ranks, seeking the approval of their sovereign. Every trace of weakness must purged and every defeat could spell doom for an aspiring conqueror. This realisation often leaves War Chiefs paranoid and choleric, while their constant need to prove their might and tactical acumen drives them to ever greater bloodshed and destruction.
023-orc_warchief.name: Orc Warchief

024-kentauros.description: Where the azure sky and the lush green of viridian grasslands meet, the Centaurs reign without equal. They are the undisputed lords of vast plains, steppes, taigas or savannahs. Being nomadic and reclusive, most live in tribal herd-clans, eternally roaming the sacred lands of their forebearers. But there are tales from the eastern fringes, describing hordes of Kentauroi coming together under the banners of a Great Khan, blocking out the skies with thousands of arrows and grinding villages, armies and fortress gates into the dust below their hooves.
024-kentauros.name: Centaur

025-trained_archer.description: Ranger, hunters or City guards standing watch on battlements or rooftops - the Trained Archer is a stand-in for every man and woman well versed in the art of the bow. They are capable sharpshooters and can be relied upon in the heat of battle, an ambush or even an assassination. With the weaker members of a party threatened with a barrage of arrows, an organized unit of Trained Archers makes for a flexible and deadly force, leading to a complex and tactical encounter for a low or even mid-level party.
025-trained_archer.name: Trained Archer

026-vampire_spawn.description: Everlasting mist floods the land of Barovia, the cursed realm of Strahd von Zahrovich. Barovia teems with dreadful creatures, most of which are hellbent on making the player's stay in their realm a harrowing one. For Spooktober 2021 we decided to give the iconic Vampire Spawns roaming the crypts and castles of Curse of Strahd a unique spin! The Barovian Vampire spawn is closely bonded to Strahd, who is the land himself, as we all know! This is reflected by increased mental stats and a strange symbiotic relationship with the mist that wreathes it's masters domain, granting a formidable foe even more power and making for a creature able to haunt even veteran players' nightmares!
026-vampire_spawn.name: Vampire Spawn

027-revenant_knight.description: The once great Knights of the Order are tragic figures, rust-flaked shades of their former selves, filled only with poisobous thoughts of vengeance and seething hatred. Our Revenant Knight is a tribute to the fallen Order of the Silver Dragon and leans more heaviliy into the tragic nobility of an undead order of Dragon-sworn Knights, with the icy essence of Argynvost still clinging to their ruined armour, in a desperate attempt to shield them from harm even in death. The lingering soul of the Silver Dragon still permeates his brothers in arms, empowering them in dynamic and unique ways.
027-revenant_knight.name: Revenant Knight

028-unchained_armor.description: The second-to-last entry of our spooky tribute to our favourite vampire-centric D&D 5e module is here! The rattlinf of chains and metallic cling-clang noises coming from the basement where no illusion, as the big bads own suit of armor has come alive to terrorize nosey parties disturbing the slumber of its master. With lightning surging through the unholy metal and the aforementioned chains eagerly dangling from its black-iron frame, our interpretation if the animated armor is even more vicious than the orignal!
028-unchained_armor.name: Unchained Armor

029-infernal_steed.description: This equine nightmare enjoys soaring through the nightly sky, terrorizing local villagers in their very, very flammable homes and (sometimes literally) booting uppity adventurers from its masters castle.
029-infernal_steed.name: Infernal Steed

030-commoner_female.description: Commoners are salt of the earth people inhabiting the various hamlets, villages, hovels and huts strewn around any country, kingdom or frontier. They can be barbers, bakers, bar- or beekeepers, hard working and tax paying folks that may welcome adventurers with open arms into the midst of their society or keep a keen eye on any outsider encroaching on their territory, threatening to make the rapidly shortening remainder of their lives more interesting.
030-commoner_female.name: Commoner Female Priest

030-commoner_male.description: Commoners are salt of the earth people inhabiting the various hamlets, villages, hovels and huts strewn around any country, kingdom or frontier. They can be barbers, bakers, bar- or beekeepers, hard working and tax paying folks that may welcome adventurers with open arms into the midst of their society or keep a keen eye on any outsider encroaching on their territory, threatening to make the rapidly shortening remainder of their lives more interesting.
030-commoner_male.name: Commoner Male Worker

031-swarm_of_vampire_bats.description: Except as a carrier of disease, a single bat does not usually pose much of a challenge for both fledgling and seasoned adventurers. But add a few hundred or even thousand bats, and you're suddenly confronted with a shrieking inferno of razor claws and pointy teeth, able to gnaw any humanoid the meat from its bones by sheer mass of bodies. Now, regular swarms of bats normally don't show signs of aggression towards beings larger than their insect prey. But in a world steeped in dark magic and beset by evil forces, bats can become dangerous creatures, revelling in a vampiric nature normally only shown by a few select subspecies of bats. These bloodthirsty swarms of bats darken the moonlight sky with ominous intent and are said to only leave drained husks in their wake...
031-swarm_of_vampire_bats.name: Swarm of Vampire Bats

032-night_hag.description: Night Hags are vile creatures, once proud denizens of the fae wild who's cruel inclinations got them banished to the Grey Wastes, an ever-gloomy hellscape out in the Far Realms. Not that it matters, for they are able to plane shift to freely spread their very own flavour of chaos, obsession and corruption by poisoning creatures dreams, driving them mad and eventually collecting their souls. Of course, we made some adjustments to the original creature, giving her two additional nightmarish abilities!
032-night_hag.name: Night Hag

033-yeti.description: Yetis are a chimeric breed, carrying an accumulation of odd traits from their ancestors. Who exactly those ancestors were is unclear, but the Yeti's immunity to even magical cold that far exceeds any natural resistances, as well as their regenerative healing abilites seem to imply a shared heritage based upon both the blood of Frost Giants as well as Trolls. How this unholy alliance came to pass remains mercifully unknown, but it is terrifying nonetheless.
033-yeti.name: Yeti

034-war_troll.description: Despite Trolls not being particularly sociable, someone just went ahead and recruited some into his merry band of raiders. The prospect of loot and food might have been enough, but no honest Troll would ever pass up the chance to deal out some unchecked violence as well. Thanks to that brave and creative individual more and more bandit leaders, orc war chiefs or mercenary captains managed to coax one of the hulking brutes into joining their venture. These War-Trolls are a tad more intelligent than their truly feral kin and, if drilled correctly, will even follow basic orders. A well trained and experienced War-Troll is truly dangerous, as it knows to efficiently apply its devastating strength to crush its enemies with ease.
034-war_troll.name: War Troll

035-roc.description: To describe Rocs as 'gigantic birds of prey' is accurate but vastly understates the horror of a creature able to carry off a fully grown elephant in its talons. They are both profane and mythical in nature, dominating their realm due to their sheer size alone, without any magical or primordial powers coursing through them. They are able to adapt to nearly any environment, causing regional differences in their appearance, as evidenced by sightings of vividly coloured tropical Rocs, as well as arctic variants with frost-wreathed pinions, preying on Yetis and Mammoths.
035-roc.name: Roc

036-winter_empress.description: The Winter Empress is a fey creature, the regent of a frost-wreathed realm of eternal ice. She is an ambitious monarch and often has her court venture out into the realm of man to bring unnatural winter in their wake. Although some claim to have bested or even slain her, tales of her defeat are often followed by even more frigid devastation at the hands of the vengeful queen of ice. With the utterly devoted Knights of Winter sworn to her service, she is considered one of the most enigmatic, yet powerful of the fair lords and ladies.
036-winter_empress.name: Winter Empress

037-royal_griffon.description: Since ages past, the Griffon has been a symbol of just and virtuos regency, earning their species the prefix 'royal'. Because of this symbolism, Royal Griffons are coveted mounts and familiars for any ambitious sovereign. Taming a feral Griffon is a dangerous and arduous undertaking, therefore most trained Griffons originate from Heralds Aerie, a mountain bastion held by an Order of Knights dedicated to forging a bond between a Griffon and its rider.
037-royal_griffon.name: Royal Griffon

038-arcane_incursor.description: Arcane Incursors resemble interplanar trapdoor spiders, as they burrow into the veil between worlds where they are lying wait, only to burst forth from their lair if magic weakens the border between planes. Once the incursion is completed, they begin their hunt for raw arcane energy, usually starting with the unlucky caster of the spell that lured the Incursor into their world. Arcane Incursors usually hunt alone, but a sufficiently great source of magic might draw more specimens, marking the beginning of an infestation with catastrophic prospects for the local mage population.
038-arcane_incursor.name: Arcane Incursor

039-elder_curseroot.description: There are many different Curseroots. Some are small, creeping vines and lumps of moss insidious in nature, some are looming and outright violent, thick-rooted and towering trees, roaring with anger. They are tainted plantlife, sprouted from evil seeds spread by a cursed tree. If even a single Cursewood is found, whole forests must be put to the torch, as the corruption spreads quickly and sometimes even a lone acorn may grow into an unfathomable evil.
039-elder_curseroot.name: Elder Curseroot

040-ossian_debt_collector.description: The Debt Collectors are operatives of the Ossian Bank, tasked with tracking and retrieving especially elusive debtors. Despite their harrowing appearance, Ossian Debt Collectors are courteous and sophisticated negotiators, blessed with the endless patience of the undead and prodigious language skills. When approaching a debtor, they initially aim on settling things amicably, politely asking the transient debtor to accompany them to the Ossian Bank to stand before the Tribunal. When met with unreasonableness or hostility, the Debt Collectors begrudgingly change tactics in favour of more direct means of apprehension. It is unclear if their skeletal appearance reflects a Collector's true being or if it only appears as such to their targets, combining two of the things mortals fear most: death and tax collectors.
040-ossian_debt_collector.name: Ossian Debt Collector

041-elephant.description: Elephants are intelligent, social and awe-inspiring creatures inhabiting savannahs, jungles and deserts of countless realms. Many cultures consider them sacred, recognizing the gentle soul of a towering, but kind creature through their caring eyes. Elephants can coexist with many different folks, acting as support for the workforce or as devastating living siege weapons in warfare. Killing wild elephants however may draw the ire of its relatives and enraged elephants are able to tear down a settlement brick by brick, if so inclined.
041-elephant.name: Elephant

042-mournbride.description: Mournbrides are the tortured souls of women dying a violent death on what was promised to be the happiest day of their lifes: their wedding day. Great tragedy usually surrounds a Mournbride's ermergence, like murder at the hands of a jealous rival or the taking of ones own life after being left at the altar. Still wrapped in the tattered and blood splattered remains of their wedding gowns, Mournbrides haunt places of great significance to the departed individual, like their family home, wedding venue or secret a meeting place with their former beloved. If their would-be spouse is still alive, the Mournbride will jealously watch over them, often causing more harm than good in their twisted need to protect them.
042-mournbride.name: Mournbride

043-mind_golem.description: Mind golems are enforcer-creatures crafted by Wizard councils, a mighty body shaped from synthetic flesh imbued with a powerful vat-grown brain, designed to contain the councils Mindmeld. A Mindmeld is psychic amalgamation of the wizards intellect and arcane potential, directly channeling their might and will into their creation, allowing it to act more independently than other forms of golems. Their fused psyches birth new independent thought slaved to their will, which makes Mind golems highly intelligent and capable of stratetic planning and tactical acumen. This, paired with their enourmous strength and innate magic abilities, makes for a truly dangerous living weapon, capable of completing the most daring operations for their masters.
043-mind_golem.name: Mind Golem

044-amygdalyan.description: Amygdalyan are predators from beyond the thin veil separating reality from the infinite ocean of madness beyond. They are drawn to trauma and tragedy like moths to a flame, first appearing in the dreams of their chosen victim, before infiltrating their mind, driving their hosts to bouts of insanity and paranoia before destroying their psyche and moving on, their perverse hunger seated for the time being. If cornered, an Amygdalyan is a cunning and perfidioius foe, using it enemies' greatest fears against them and until they perish from the strain the constant terror puts on their body and mind.
044-amygdalyan.name: Amygdalyan

045-shattermaw.description: Shattermaws are colossal bad-tempered monstrosities clad in nearly impenetrable osteodermic armour, consisting of bone knobs, plates and spine-like outgrows. Despite their turtle-like appearance, they appear to be an evolutionary offshoot of semi-aquatic sharks. Their thick leathery skin mirrors the swamp-green of their habitat and their cragged shells and bone protrusions become eventually overgrown by moss, algae and lichens, making Shattermaws surprisingly difficult to notice. Their diet consists of everything unlucky enough to wander in front of its eponymous maw, supplemented by anything barely resembling actual prey - including mossy logs, mid-sized boulders or small vehicles. This leads to swamps and river banks within Shattermaw territory being lined with the wreckage of skiffs or rafts displaying their signature corrosive bite marks.
045-shattermaw.name: Shattermaw

046-garghoul.description: A variant form of the common Ghoul, its tattered wings making it capable of flight. After nightfall, GarGhouls stalk the skies. They are to locate worthwile prey, alerting their swarm upon discovery. As one, the GarGhouls descend, paralyzing their victims with their bite before carrying them off into the dark. If acting as part of a larger force of Ghouls under the command of a higher Ghoul unlifeform, GarGhouls often form the second wave of a larger invasion, using their maddening screams to disorient their terrified victims, before the main force emerges from their hidden dwellings. Swarms of GarGhouls also patrol the vast caverns of the subterran Ghoul realms, seeking out intruders and calling their pale brethren to join them in their feast.
046-garghoul.name: Garghoul

047-swifttalon_raptor.description: Lightning fast, agile and deadly - Swifttalon Raptors showcase peak evolutionary efficiency. They hunt in small packs, stalking and outmaneuvering prey much larger than themselves. When the Raptors have their prey encircled, they first attack in waves, probing their quarry's defenses and opening up gashing wounds with their crooked talons. Lastly they overwhelm with numbers, bearing down on their exhausted prey in a flood of scales, teeth and claws.
047-swifttalon_raptor.name: Swifttalon Raptor

048-stormwyvern.description: An especially powerful Blue dragon can infuse a wyvern with its arcane draconic energy, elevating it to a Stormwyvern. Stormwyverns are bestowed a semblance of their master's elemental affinity and cunning. They serve in the dragon's forces as heralds and subcommanders, their increased intelligence allowing for a rudimentary grasp on the draconic language and a crude understanding of battle tactics.
048-stormwyvern.name: Stormwyvern

049-poisonfang.description: Poisonfangs are the elite assassins of the various serpent cults infesting overgrown temple cities or infiltrating colonial societies. Promising candidates are singled out from their brood mates early on, undergoing harrowing psycho-indoctrination to increase their resistances to various poisons and toxins, hone their inherent hypnotic abilities and trigger the transformation into a even more snake-like being. Due to their unique talents they become excellent operatives, making Poison Fangs ideal tools for political assassinations, terror campaigns or insidious purges within the own ranks.
049-poisonfang.name: Poisonfang Assassin

050-amber_idol.description: Amber Idols are constructs crafted from anointed amber, fossilized resin obtained from sacred trees. While humanoid in stature and gait, their heads resemble bestial guardian spirits of old. Amber Idols are tasked with guarding hidden temples and lost sites that harbour great evil, tirelessly patrolling ancient gaols to ensure the continued confinement of the horrors sealed within.
050-amber_idol.name: Amber Idol

051-toxic_gobbler.description: Toxic as a Gobbler is a common idiom and yet it understates the danger posed by a Gobbler. Their garishly coloured, lumpy and spongy skin hides toxin glands which release a quickly evaporating colour- and odorless toxin that, upon skin contact or inhalation, leads to harrowing pain, long lasting paralysis and even death. Due to this feature, Gobblers have almost no natural predators, causing them to generally act carefree, curious and playful. This  makes them even more dangerous, as Gobblers fearlessly seek out the company of other beings to play with them - oftentimes accidently killing them in the process.  Some assume the toxiCity to be a result of the Gobbler's diet, raising the question on what on earth Gobblers are eating.
051-toxic_gobbler.name: Toxic Gobbler

052-wendigo.description: Wendigos plague humanoid Civilized since the dawn of time. Nothing embodies the cruelty and danger of untamed Wilderness as well as the Wendigo. They are the terror of the Wilderness incarnate, primal fear given a gangly shape and raking claws. Their true origin remains unknown, but some cultures perceive them to be spirits of hunger and greed, possessing avaricious individuals and turning them into the ferocious predators that stalk dark woods and bleak frontiers, hunting and devouring their former kin. Wendigos are swift and silent hunters, terrifying stalkers and savage butchers, capable of outmaneuvering and outsmarting even well-armed and steadfast groups of adventurers before unleashing upon them a terrifying display of primal carnage, leaving red snow in their wake, as they adorn their hunting grounds with grisly trophies.
052-wendigo.name: Wendigo

053-magmatic_coreborn.description: Coreborn rise from fissures or smoldering calderas as a result of increased volcanic activity. Combining aspects of both fire and earth elementals, they differ from their kin due to their amiable disposition towards humanoids. A Magmatic Coreborn may choose to protect a village built on the slope of a volcano or at the heart of a high island, using its dominance over earth and fire to ward off both natural and unnatural disaster from their chosen people. Many Coreborn are worshipped as minor deities by their tribes, growing in power through veneration.
053-magmatic_coreborn.name: Magmatic Coreborn

054-bog_strider.description: Bog Striders are large predatory insects towering on spindly legs, commonly found in swamps, marshes or the eponymous bogs. Bog Striders are attracted to their prey by ripples in the murky water, using their front legs as sensors for the vibrations. The Bog Strider aims to puncture its prey's body with its proboscis and injects acidic saliva that liquifies the innards, sucking out the resulting fluid. Due to their low intelligence and high dependency on pheromonal markings, they can be controlled with special pheromonal cocktails, making them ideal mounts for traversing wetlands.
054-bog_strider.name: Bog Strider

055-klabautermann.description: Klabautermänner are manifestations of a ships spirit, a result of a deep bond between a storied vessel and its crew. Mostly acting as an unseen force of good, when taking physical Klabautermänner love to manifest as a skeletal mariner, guiding their threatened vessel through a storm, repelling a boarding party or assisting in navigating treacherous waters. As a crew's bond and reputation grows, so does the Klabautermann's power - the mightiest of them being able to assert their control over weather and sea to prevent imminent disaster.
055-klabautermann.name: Klabautermann

056-sword_guardian.description: Not long after the invention of the trusty Shield Guardian demand  for a more attack-oriented counterpart spiked. This lead to the development of the Sword Guardian, a more nimble, albeit less hardy construct that excels at close quarter combat. Their combat tactics can be switched at a moment's notice, making them both capable bodyguards and assertive enforcers. While their stiff movements appear predictable, incautious opponents often find themselves blocked in by an unending barrage of precise Greatsword blows. Like their defensive brother-constructs, they are valuable assets for wizards in need of some artifical muscle or wealthy merchants looking for an effective deterrent.
056-sword_guardian.name: Sword Guardian

057-ridgeback_dunecrawler.description: Due to the spinal ougrowths on their upper shell, Ridgebacks can easily be mistaken for a cragged rock formation, especially when partially buried beneath the arid soil of their preferred habitat. They continually filter swathes of sand through gill-like structures, indiscriminately feeding on organic and non-organic matter, be it mineral deposits, plants, living creatures or dried out carcasses. A wandering or resting Ridgeback does not pose any particular danger, nomadic tribes are known to hitch a ride on a Dunecrawler's back to traverse the desert without the great beast paying them any mind. But their temper matches their size, and an angered Ridgeback resembles a force of nature, a walking mountain with titanic strength, shrouded in an ever-swirling tempest of sand.
057-ridgeback_dunecrawler.name: Ridgeback Dunecrawler

058-vrubel.description: Braying flocks of Vrubel cloud the multicoloured skies of the Abyss, their harrowing shrieks unnaturally reveberating through the twisted landscapes of madness. A gathering of Vrubel forms a choir, each of their voices intertwining into the abyssal dirge, a maddening song capable of twisting and breaking the minds of even the most stalwart individuals. The abyssal choirs act as demonic envoys, transmitting messages for higher demons to other planes of existence, carrying with them the innate chaos of the Abyss.
058-vrubel.name: Vrubel

059-gladiator_dimachaerus.description: The Dimachaerus is the diva of the arena, a master duelist who captivates the audience with artistic bladework and dizzying acrobatics. Fluidly switching between offensive and defensive fighting styles, the Dimachaerus prides themself on their ability to face any opponent, capable of outmaneuvering both the nimble Retiarius and outfighting the towering Murmillo. But a Dimachaerus balances on a knife's edge, any misstep in their complex choreography will be punished by their opponents - and the fickle audience, its favour as easily withdrawn as it is granted.
059-gladiator_dimachaerus.name: Gladiator Dimachaerus

059-gladiator_murmillo.description: The brutish Murmillo however is recruited from the ranks of the most steadfast fighters, almost impossible to topple and capable of withstanding tremendous punishment. Both are evenly matched and capable of holding the audience's attention with their taunts and flourishes, their signature maneuvers and lethal finishers.
059-gladiator_murmillo.name: Gladiator Murmillo

059-gladiator_retiarius.description: Gladiators are grouped into different types, varying heavily in both fighting style and equipment. Certain types of Gladiator exclusively fight their respective counterpart, each fight resembling a deadly choreography studied to perfection. Retiarius and Murmillo exclusively duel each other, both of their skills honed to overcome the other. The Retiarius is a flink-footed and more lightly armoured fighter who nimbly evades their more heavily armoured opponent, only to artfully entangle them with their net and set up the perfect thrust from their trident.
059-gladiator_retiarius.name: Gladiator Retiarius

060-crazed_reaper.description: Incessant screaming heralds the approach of the Crazed Reaper, a towering monstrosity filled with apoplectic madness and massive scythes for hands. It is to be assumed that these creatures did not came to be in a way even remotely considered natural and any means of reproduction short of mitosis by sheer force of anger seems unlikely. But until the source of their all-consuming madness is discovered, solitary Reapers will roam the lands, driven to murder anything that stands in their path, leaving a trail of severed limbs and burst ear drums in their wake, as well as more questions that could possibly be answered.
060-crazed_reaper.name: Crazed Reaper

061-clangorsaurus.description: Clangosaurs roam lost and forgotten parts of the world where unique circumstances allow for flora and fauna from primeval times to endure. Both male and female members of the species engange in territorial disputes by smashing their bone-plated heads against each other, a ritual that produces a sound that can be heard for miles. Clangorsaurs are highly aggressive, actively seeking confrontation with anything treading on their stomping grounds, crashing into their targets without any shreds of self preservation.
061-clangorsaurus.name: Clangorsaurus

062-pit_abomination.description: Abominations are born from accursed breeding pits using forbidden biomancy, heretical alchemical formulae and mutagens harvested from countless monstrosities. Each Abomination comes out differently, as the primordial soup filling the pits is ever shifting in its makeup and consistency, but they all have an inherited hate for this cruel world that birthed them. Impervious to pain and unable to form complex thoughts, it is a living weapon capable of unfathomable destruction. A weapon wielded by Pit Broodmasters, a caste dedicated to training and bonding with the towering abominations, feeding their hate and driving them into combat, annihilating everything in their path.
062-pit_abomination.name: Pit Abomination

062-pit_broodmaster.description: They themselves tainted by the vile alchemy and mutagens of the Breeding Pits, Broodmasters tear the pit spawn from their birthing sacs and beat their will into the mewling creature. What follows is an inhuman regiment of subjugation and conditioning, to form the pit spawn into an unfeeling instrument of war. The most vile creature birthed from the pits is the Abomination, a chimeric monstrosity combining traits from countless creatures into a looming behemoth capable of unfathomable destruction. These war-beasts are herded into slaughter by the Broodmasters, controlled by secret drugs and techniques only known to initiatives to their corrupted caste.
062-pit_broodmaster.name: Pit Broodmaster

063-beckoning_devil.description: Beckoning Devil's are favoured courtiers of the Father of Lies, one of the ruling Devils of the Nine Hells. With their seductive and corrupting powers, they seek to gain control over groups of powerful individuals to drive them into ruin, only to finally offer them salvation in their Lord's service. They possess a malign intelligence and relish their dark purpose, drawing great pleasure from the hunt. Once fixated on future servants worthy of their Lord, Beckoning Devils are relentless stalkers, quickly forcing their prey to question their sanity, as their paranoia swells and memories become unreliable. Those dominated by the Devil they are finally forced to commit harrowing atrocities, until they are left with no choice but to bow their knee to the dark patron of Lies.
063-beckoning_devil.name: Beckoning Devil

064-grey_pilgrim.description: The unusual beings dubbed Grey Pilgrims wander the realms in search for enlightenment, be it in solitude, be it accompanied by disciples or mentors of their own choosing. Each of them has been given form by divine hands, created to study as much as to teach. They continuously reflect on the principles of divinity, the cosmos and the nature of mortality, each Pilgrim eventually reaching their own conclusion, before imparting their knowledge unto worthy souls and returning to the side of their creator. While on their journey, they go out of their way to inspire the ambition and resolve of those burdened by strife and suffering..
064-grey_pilgrim.name: Grey Pilgrim

065-sovereigns_guard.description: Kings and Queens, Hierophants and Arch-Bishops, Emperors and Empresses - these sovereigns dare not resting their wellbeing on the meek shoulders of regular guards or hired mercenaries. A true sovereign requires an elite guard, drilled fighters of supreme ability and mental strength, eager to continously prove their worth and unwavering loyalty. The Sovereign's Guard represent an elite cadre of bodyguards and combat specialists, well versed in both protecting their liege or carrying out special tasks all over the realm.
065-sovereigns_guard.name: Sovereign's Guard

066-scorched_legionary.description: The Scorched Legion's origins lie within the ash-choked plains of the Realm of Fire. The lords of the realm are in constant warfare, their mortal troops long expended. Unyielding, relentless soldiers were formed from volcanic rock and embers of the Primordial Flame. Soon the Scorched Legionaries waged eternal war on their masters behalf, their conflicts soon encroaching onto the mortal realms. They are devastating heavy infantry, blindly following their master's commands, untiring and without mercy. Many a desperate sovereign turns to the lords of the Fire Realm as a means to aquire the might of the Legion for their own purpose, not knowing, that by doing so they may doom the very realm they try to protect or conquer.
066-scorched_legionary.name: Scorched Legionary

067-rustmire_gadfly.description: Rustmire Gadflies infest the auburn marshlands of the Rustmire, their incessant droning turning this already wicked place into even more of a hostile hellscape. By the dozens a swarm of Gadflies descents on a suitable victim - be it man or beast - and feed on them, leaving it bite-marked but alive, as they do not kill their victims (intentionally, at least), but prefer to feed on it over the span of days or weeks instead. They are, however, carriers of the unsavoury and often lethal Bloodscorch plague and can often be found feeding on the pustulent remains of their infected victim.
067-rustmire_gadfly.name: Rustmire Gadfly

068-wereboar.description: Skinchangers come in any shape or size and even the cause of their transformation differs - be it affliction of body or mind, a curse, possession or even a blessing. The transformation into a Wereboar, however, seldom is anything but a curse, one reserved mostly for gluttonous and vulgar individuals, whose porcine characteristics where apparent even before their body took a shape their mind had already taken. Wereboars are boorish and brutish, bulky and barrelchested slabs of pure muscle, held together by a thick hide. But their cunning is not to be unterestimated and many would-be slayers fell to the goring tusks of a Wereboar after failing to discern the sparks of malign intellect within their deep-set eyes.
068-wereboar.name: Wereboar

068-wereboar_2.description: Skinchangers come in any shape or size and even the cause of their transformation differs - be it affliction of body or mind, a curse, possession or even a blessing. The transformation into a Wereboar, however, seldom is anything but a curse, one reserved mostly for gluttonous and vulgar individuals, whose porcine characteristics where apparent even before their body took a shape their mind had already taken. Wereboars are boorish and brutish, bulky and barrelchested slabs of pure muscle, held together by a thick hide. But their cunning is not to be unterestimated and many would-be slayers fell to the goring tusks of a Wereboar after failing to discern the sparks of malign intellect within their deep-set eyes.
068-wereboar_2.name: Wereboar

069-dollmaker_devil.description: Like all of their infernal kindred, Dollmaker Devils relish in the seduction and eventual corruption of mortal souls. They take s rather direct approach, using their cursed touch to turn their victims into paralyzed dolls and binding them via infernal threads, entangling a creature's very soul. This allows the Devil to take on the role of a perverse puppeteer, controlling a creatures immediate actions by tugging the right strings or even ending their life with a swift severing of the threads. Dollmakers are craven creatures, relying on networks of worshippers or debtors to protect it, while it stalks nightly streets for fresh dolls.
069-dollmaker_devil.name: Dollmaker Devil

070-airship_sentry_automaton.description: Automated sentries were first utilized during a great exhibition showcasing different proofs of concept concerning the development of techno-arcane automata. These prototypes were expanded upon by military scientists and now serve as sentries and boarding repellents on various airships throughout the realms. Their armaments consist of heavy boarding axes, short-ranged ocular beams and advanced kinetic shielding, all powered by a miniature techno-arcane reactor. These sentries are able to activate a magnetic field, allowing them to safely battle any threats while being mag-locked to an airship's metal hull. Gunner variants are also known to operate the heavy Thunderstrike Pattern Airship Cannons utilized by great military airships, such as the Dawn Emperor and Storm Herald class.
070-airship_sentry_automaton.name: Airship Sentry Automaton

071-blade_slave.description: Blade Slaves are living weapons created by the dozens and hundreds, prisoners, heretics and other undesirables with their body and mind broken by confinement and torture. They now only crave the kiss of the blade, living vicariously through both the pain they suffer and the pain they inflict upon others. They are utilized by Ecclesiarchs and Inquisitors, driven before them as a showing of ruthlessness and intimidaton or unleashed from their Mobile confines as shock troops, overwhelming their master's enemies as a cackling and foaming wave of bodies and blades.
071-blade_slave.name: Blade Slave

072-slipstream_phaseknife.description: Equipped with experimental techno-arcane Slipstream Generators, Phaseknives are an elite cadre of operatives specialised in high-risk assassinations that require pinpoint accuracy and leave no room for errors. Seamlessly phasing in and out of a subspace corridor dubbed the Slipstream, they effortlessly outmaneuver and overwhelm conventional defenses and deliver a perfect killing strike. Traditionally, Phaseknives work in pairs to ensure the mission's success, coordinating their unpredictable attacks at a breackneck pace, relying on speed and accuracy honed to perfection to carry out their missions.
072-slipstream_phaseknife.name: Slipstream Phaseknife

073-gorgeleaper.description: Gorgeleapers are arboreal hunters, leaping through mazelike treetops of the sky-scraping southern rainforests. They are expert climbers and navigate the treacherous terrain of their homes with terrifying ease, effortlessly stalking their prey before ambushing it. Gorgeleapers do not kill their prey immediately but swallow it instead, carrying the creature in their gullet to hidden birthing pools in the rainfilled calyxes of the aptly named Nursery Chalice, a carnivorous pitcher plant existing in symbiosis with the Gorgeleapers.
073-gorgeleaper.name: Gorgeleaper

074-undead_pikeman.description: Hushed voices tell of the Burial Host, an endless column of shambling undead pressed into service by a council of necromancers, fleshgrafters and carnal artisans. Heralded by the buzzing of bloated flies, the Burial Host descends upon cities or countryside alike, overwhelming even the sturdiest defenses in an unending onslaught of rotten flesh and rusted blades. Gaps within the ranks of the host are quickly filled, as the war machinery grinds forward, a self-serving and self-sustaining perpetuum Mobile of death and rebirth. Undead Pikemen form the front rows of the Host, forcing their enemies into exasperating wars of attrition
074-undead_pikeman.name: Undead Pikeman

075-guild_artillerist.description: Due to government contracts, the (traditionally dwarven) members of the great Powder Guilds, those organisations authorized to research and develop mechanical firearms, are also utilized as a well-trained militia, often requiring mandatory service escorting the great Trade Fleets trawling the great Archipelago. This leaves many guild members with first-hand combat experience and some will stay within the military branch of the guilds, choosing the life of an Artillerist over that of an Artisan. They serve with a deep understanding of their craft, burning to further hone their skills as combat engineers, artillery and demolition specialists or expert marksmen.
075-guild_artillerist.name: Guild Artillerist

076-deathsworn.description: Seeing a Deathsworn fight is witnessing a ceremonial choreography, as they seamlessly weave their opponents into an intimate dance of death. Deathsworn exhibit great respect towards their enemies, going so far as to carry the ritually cleaned and hallowed skulls of particularly worthy opponents alongside of those of their closest kin - signifying their bond forged in battle, either on equal or opposing sides. The certainty of their own death is meaningless to a Deathsworn, as they resign to it each time they take up their spear and shroud their face with the Sho'ufa, expressing their resolve to kill and die honorably in the eyes of their ancestors.
076-deathsworn.name: Deathsworn

077-necromancer.description: Necromancers are magic users who pursued the arcane arts beyond the restrictions that nature and mortality place upon less curious souls. Death is a strong metaphysical concept and those tapping into the domain of biological and metaphysical death quickly find themselves swelling with power, as they carry life into the realms of death to reanimate bodies or manipulate souls, or invite death into the realms of the living, turning flesh to dust and withering body and soul. This power quickly corrupts and many societies fear, shun or hunt those who passed the treshold and invited death into their life.
077-necromancer.name: Necromancer

078-necrovolt_circuitslave.description: Circuitslaves are burned-out husks powered by the abyssal energies of the Netherstorm. Through the shapeless Necrovolt, a being of sentient lightning accidentally created and worshipped by the Reanimator Conclaves, they are connected to their masters in a cursed circuit, living lightning coursing continously coursing through them. They eternally hunger for more energy, seeking out living creatures to drain their bodies of it.
078-necrovolt_circuitslave.name: Necrovolt Circuitslave

078-necrovolt_reanimator.description: The Necrovolt Reanimators are a conclave of deranged scientists who discovered the abyssal Netherstorm, a sentient tempest of howling souls, charged with cracking aether-lightning. Reanimators harness the Netherstorm's boundless energy with their Necrovoltaic Generators, using it to power various nightmarish machineries and undead constructs. Over time fanatical members of the Reanimator Conclave seemingly discerned sentience within their own devices, remnants of the soul-lightning powering them. This ghost in the machine was dubbed the Necrovolt, a being of unliving lightning made manifest.
078-necrovolt_reanimator.name: Necrovolt Reanimator

079-mummy.description: Ages ago Ankh was ruled by ancient god-beasts, forcing their subjects to conquer a vast empire in their name. The surrounding realms where powerless against the god-beasts otherworldly might and divine wrath and soon an empire was carved from bone, blood and sand with mighty monuments of worship rising from the desert ground wherever the slave-armies of Ankh marched. The god-beasts were cast down using the cthonian Duat Blades, their wielders were lauded as heroes and ruled Ankh for ages, their lifespan unnaturally extended by the cursed blades. As they eventually died, they would rise again and reclaim their blades, their embalmed and mummified bodies serving as hollow vessels for the energies of the Duat. Legions of shambling mummies follow in their wake, once more called to war by their queens and princes, now waging war on their own erstwhile kin-blood.
079-mummy.name: Mummy

080-sharakhul.description: Ages ago, the great dragon Sharakhul fell victim to a hive of Mind Tyrants, a psionically gifted race of subterran conquerers and slavers. Seeking a new vessel for their abominable hive mind, they spend decades torturing the dragon into submission, bent on erasing his spirit, originally intent on leaving the body intact. But the great dragon resisted and as punishment they psychically flayed him, stripping away his indomitable scales and reducing his form to a mass of undulating flesh.His body flayed and defiled, his mind fractured in unmendable ways, the broken husk of Sharakhul rose from the depths and sought exile, pouring himself into foul methods of blood magic in a desperate attempt to mend his flesh and restore his scales
080-sharakhul.name: Sharakhul

081-crusader.description: Crusaders are chosen warriors infused with holy purpose, traveling the lands to retrieve lost relics, protect priests and pilgrims or enact divine judgement against sworn enemies of their patron saint or deity. They are singular in devotion, trained in the arts of war from a young age and eager to prove their worthiness at any cost.
081-crusader.name: Crusader

082-shell_sage.description: Shell-Sages wander the lands oblivious to possible danger, protected only by their trusty shell, sheer legendary luck and the hesitation of possible predators, as their would-be prey moves through their territory with confusing self-assuredness and tranquility. Shell-Sages owe their title to the habit of withdrawing into the safety of their eponymous shell, spending days and even weeks in deep contemplation, from which they they only awake due to the excitement experienced by stumbling upon especially profound insights. Wild animals or curious people are drawn to the shell, listening to the calming, mumbled utterances echoing from within the shell.
082-shell_sage.name: Shell Sage

083-hydra.description: The Hydra is an ancient nightmare given form, coiling serpent heads, their curved fangs dripping with lethal poison and a towering reptile body capable of moving with unsettling grace - there is nothing about the Hydra that does not evoke vivid imagery and primal fears whenever its name is whispered. Hydrae are dangerous to hunt, as even a mortally wounded beast might return after only days have passed and whole swathes of land have been put to the torch to drive such a monstrosity from its lair and finally put an end to it.
083-hydra.name: Hydra

084-mimic.description: It is unclear how exactly Mimics came to be. The leading theory proposes that a Wizard sought a way to secure his riches and enchanted a chest to simply make it come alive and eat intruders, which, knowing wizards, does not seem too far-fetched. How we ended up with the voracious ambush predators taking all manner of shapes or for ms still poses some unanswered questions. Similarly, unclear is how Mimics reproduce, even if the thought of pocket-sized chests with big eyes is delightful. Some theorize that Mimic eggs eerily resemble gold coins, allowing Mimics to mix their brood into the treasures they guard.
084-mimic.name: Mimic

085-aberrant_tyrant.description: Aberrant Tyrants birth themselves into the Material Plane through their dreams and nightmares. Considering themselves the apex of creation, an Aberrant Tyrant's worst nightmare is to be trapped in a world filled with inferior creatures. Due to the nature of the dreamlands beyond the veil, these nightmares are manifested, and the Tyrant is brought forth into the mundane world, where it promptly goes mad from the combined horrors of this experience and the utter contempt towards the vile inhabitants of this hellscape. Some Tyrants however dream of subjugating foreign worlds their inhabitants, only to wake up finally being able to do so. They are, however, no less insane.
085-aberrant_tyrant.name: Aberrant Tyrant

086-fire_manifestation.description: Fire Manifestations a living blazes inhabiting the ever-burning plane of Eternal Fire. Into this ash-choked realm of red sand and molten rock retreated the primordial beings of flame once the immense magic potential necessary to feed them slowly bled from the young world's bones into the beings of flesh and blood that slowly came to inhabit and shape it. The Manifestations are personified elemental forces, fire's unsatiable hunger and destructive nature given flickering form. In the profane world, Manifestations flock to places connected to their native plane or appear in the wake of fire-related disasters powerful enough to tear through the veil between planes.
086-fire_manifestation.name: Fire Manifestation

087-wintergrim.description: Sudden drops in temperature and billowing snowstorms herald the coming of a Wintergrim. Wintergrim are murderous fey creatures and intrude into the profane world during a time where the temperature drops to unnatural lows and the snow mantle becomes a burial shroud for humans and livestock alike. Hunters don't return from the forest, rime coats windows and even a fire's heat may no longer banish the exisential cold that has seeped into body and spirit. Until banished by the return of spring, the Wintergrim will hunt, its pale bestial hands choking life and and warmth from its victims, leaving behind only icy skin and blood on the snow. At the seasonal height of its power, even powerful iron wards may not keep a Wintergrim at bay and many a frontier village turns to ancient pacts sealed with blood and sacrifice instead.
087-wintergrim.name: Wintergrim

088-magarach_sentinel.description: Magarach were created as an ancient warrior caste to serve the formless Waking One as temple guardians, but were abandoned by their creator. With the Magarach still tending to overgrown vestiges of past glory, nature has reclaimed the once thriving temple complexes and the Magarach, blessed with the right to bathe within the sacred waters they guard, are granted longevity bordering on immortality. The Magarach protect these hidden wells, as within the sacred waters the essence of the Waking One still lingers on. Upon death, a Magarach's soul returns to these wells and it will soon rise once more, accumulating hundreds of lifetimes worth of experience, knowledge and grudges over the centuries..
088-magarach_sentinel.name: Magarach Sentinel

089-berserker.description: Berserkers are chosen warriors who rejected a normal life and embraced the savage nature of the Bear. Giving in to the totemic spirit they were transformed, taking on the form of the great Beast from which they draw their otherworldly strenghs. Either as nomadic sages or part of a group of warriors they seek glory and adventure, tightly wrapped by the strings of fate - a Berserker is sure to either become a scourge upon the land or a fabled folk hero, there is no room for mediocrity.
089-berserker.name: Berserker

090-swordbearer_reliquary.description: Swordbearer Reliquaries are vestiges of past ages, walking shrines dedicated to a forgotten deity of war and valor. These silent effigies are named Swordbearers, for ancient blades are driven deeply into their craggy form, unclear to which purpose - remembrance or veneration? It is also unknown what causes life to spark within the overgrown form of the Reliquary, causing it to rise and wander. Maybe the souls of the ancient blades thirst for battle once more, or maybe the lost deity itself slowly wakes from its god-slumber, sending out these living shrines as solemn emissaries to seek out worthy warriors to receive the old god's favor.
090-swordbearer_reliquary.name: Swordbearer Reliquary

091-guild_heretic.description: Former artisans of the great Powder, Steam and Clockwork guilds disgraced for their continued interest in banned technologies gathered around Rekwyn Gharst, the master artisan often referred to as a heretic. Shunned and in hiding due to their perverse pursuit of Viscerart, a self-coined portmanteau elevating intricate bloodshed and indiscriminate bombings to a controversial artform, the Heretics are a collective of like-minded individuals, continually developing new mechanical abominations, which exist in mockery of the fragility of the humanoid form. Guild Heretics take great pride in their devastating arsenal and each drop of spilled blood is a badge of honour..
091-guild_heretic.name: Guild Heretic

092-gargling_headtaker.description: Gargling Headtakers roam shallow waters and coastal regions, inhabiting flooded coves or stranded shipwrecks. They are an unsettling sight, lumbering mancrabs, foam dripping ceaselessly from their strange crustacean mouthparts, unfeeling eyes and wiggling antennas. As they hunt in small packs, their characteristic and disquieting gargling noises used to communicate oftentimes herald an incoming attack. When fighting, the Headtakers make use of their oversized pincers, grasping, impaling or crushing their prey, knowing no difference between man or animal.
092-gargling_headtaker.name: Gargling Headtaker

093-faceless.description: Faceless are demons of murder, summoned by ritual and bound to a worldy anchor by its summoner. Faceless tirelessly hunt their prey, unhindered by locks, guards or castle walls. Despite acting independently, each Faceless is an aspect of a greater demonic entity, either unable or unwilling to leave its home plane. This makes Faceless all the more terrifying, as a designated victim oftentimes finds itself harried by a neverending stream of demonic incursions until it finally succumbs to the continuous assaults. A creature targeted by the Faceless can only hope for the summoner's death or to evade its own demise long enough to wear out the patience of the demon.
093-faceless.name: Faceless

094-skeletal_sapper.description: Skeletal Sappers were devised by the Bonemason Pioneers of the Burial Host. Sappers are driven towards fortified settlements to tear holes into their defenses, allowing the rest to advance through the ruined fortifications. These tactics were quickly adopted by ambitious necromancers and ossian artisans throughout the realms.
094-skeletal_sapper.name: Skeletal Sapper

095-auxiliary_automaton.description: Auxiliary Automata are the next evolutionary step within the field of techno-arcane developments. It is outfitted with an advanced crystalline logic core that allows it to make decisions within a pre-defined perimeter, a sturdy chassis able to withstand considerable damage and gravity defying hover-generators, allowing it to navigate difficult terrain with ease. These prototypes are bristling with experimental weaponry and are designed for boarding actions within the tight confines of Airship corridors, being able to block off parts of the ship with geomantic hard-light barriers or act as a spearhead to breach fortified positions.
095-auxiliary_automaton.name: Auxiliary Automaton

096-coastal_marauder.description: Marauders rely on speed and the element of surprise to overun less fortified and sparsely defended targets like coastal hamlets or monasteries. If met with resistance, the momentum of the attack needs to be upheld at any cost. Independed veteran war bands split off from the main force to hunt down enemy clusters before they can mount an organized defense. As houses go up in flames, the thick smoke covers the retreat back to the ship and onto the open sea..
096-coastal_marauder.name: Coastal Marauder

096-stormwrath_marauder.description: Stormwrath Marauders are conduits of the tempest's fury, their heart beating in tact with the rolling thunder. Warriors might be born blessed by the storms or elevated by a higher being that holds command over the elements, such as a Storm Giant, a dragon or even a god. They become chosen warriors, stalwart in their faith and honoured keepers of the naval rites..
096-stormwrath_marauder.name: Stormwrath Marauder

097-hoplite.description: Heavy infantry fighting in unison, shield to shield and with their spears raised they stand against onrushing waves of attackers - regardless the setting, Hoplites fighting in phalanx formation are a powerful image to evoke. As it took more than two thousand years to dethrone the phalanx as the most effective method of ancient warfare, one has to wonder how how effective it might be in a fantasy setting, supported by magic or divine powers.
097-hoplite.name: Hoplite

098-knight_of_tragedy.description: Collapsed under the weight of their oaths, these fallen Knights are bound to ruined castles or abandoned chapels. Some sold their souls to protect their brethren, transgressed against their patron saint or broke their oath so severly that it resulted in the total corruption of their being. Whatever the reason for their downfall, these erstwhile epitomes of piety and righteousness have become dark mirrors of their past, now doomed to cause the same pain and suffering they were once sworn to fight. Steeped in tragedy, these Knights are solemn creatures, most harboring the secret desire to die in combat, being finally brought to justice by a righteous blade.
098-knight_of_tragedy.name: Knight Of Tragedy

099-shipbreaker_leviathan.description: Exhibiting highly aggressive behaviour towards sea vessels, this leviathan class monstrosity of proto-reptilian heritage earned the designation -Shipbreaker-. An sentient oceanic predator of terrifying size, the Shipbreaker Leviathan hunts aquatic megafauna, its domain extending from the wave-crested open waters to the crushing hadopelagic depths. Sightings of wounded or slain specimen covered in scars and bitemarks allow a glimpse into the nightmarish realm of the oceanic void, where not even Leviathans are safe from being preyed upon.
099-shipbreaker_leviathan.name: Shipbreaker Leviathan

100-luck_dragon.description: In stark contrast to their domineering and tyrannical brethren, these travel sized dragons usually prefer a friendly scratch behind the ears to worship and subjugation. They do not take themselves very seriously and admire this quality in others, known to both form strong bonds of friendship, as well as petty, but well-spirited rivalries. It is unclear if the Luck Dragon's existence implies the existence of a Bad Luck Dragon, but experts argue that regular Dragons could already be considered Bad Luck Dragons.
100-luck_dragon.name: Luck Dragon

101-stonegorger.description: Stonegorgers are an enigmatic offshoot of giant-kin, lacking the majesty and grandeur of their mythical brethren. Called Skoldborer in their native tongue, fables claim that Stonegorgers devour rock and stone to get to the gems, ores and minerals within in an attempt to reunite their earthen mother with her treasures. Accumulating these precious materials within their bodies, they slowly turn into stone themselves. As they approach the end of their life, they seek ever greater depths, finally succumbing to age and pressure, returning earth's treasures to its womb. The earth welcomes its wayward children back and gracefully accepts the gifts they bring, rewarding the Stonegorger by slowly turning it into a being of pure diamond, in death finally achieving the beauty it always pursued.
101-stonegorger.name: Stonegorger

102-gatebreaker_devil.description: Lacking the subtleness of their more devious kin, Gatebreaker Devils are part of the infernal vanguard, leading the charge upon the event of an incursion, as they charge through the brimstone gates and trample anything in their way. Eager to inflict wrath and violence upon the world, they are often called upon by Diabolists and Summoners to enact violence in their service. As they are lesser devils in that sense that they merely represent an aspect of a sin, rather than holding command over it, they are less likely to intentionally try and corrupt their temporary master.
102-gatebreaker_devil.name: Gatebreaker Devil

103-gloomspore_harvester.description: Gloomspore Harvesters haunt jungles and fungus forests, swamps, subterran groves and even occasionally overgrown City sewers. In dim light, their gaunt upper body resembles a scrawny tree, while it gently shifts its weight between its branch-like six legs, allowing it to silently stride through thick underbrush, as well as crawl-climb through the tree tops. A gentle rain of soft-glowing spores surrounds it, allowing the Harvester to sense its surroundings and infesting living creatures. Each infested creature appears as a radiant beacon to the Harvester, who in turn skulks towards it to harvest its weakened prey's dwindling energy.
103-gloomspore_harvester.name: Gloomspore Harvester

104-bone_host.description: A Bone Host is no single demon, rather a tendril of a multifacteded demonic swarm-being inhabiting one of several host bodies of gnarled bone. This demonic consciousness, resembling a shoal of abyssal energy, is spread over several Bone Hosts, fighting and hunting together in fiendish synchroniCity..
104-bone_host.name: Bone Host

105-ogre_mercenary.description: Better armed and more intelligent than their more feral brethren, these hulking henchmen are still known for their insatiable appetite for treasure and their considerable strength, making them a force to be reckoned with. Beneath their brutish exterior lies a mischievous sense of humor that often catches their victims off-guard.
105-ogre_mercenary.name: Ogre Mercenary

106-equiterrean.description: Equiterreans resemble horses carved from mossy rock, decked with a coat of rich earthy tones, adorned with vibrant greenery and blooming flowers. They are stalwart and gentle beings, channeling the lifegiving powers of earth and sun, mending wounds and restoring vigor. Loyal servants to those having dominion over the earthen aspect of the elemental spheres are often bestowed with such a steed as a boon, but Equiterreans may also choose to accept a worthy being as their rider themselves.
106-equiterrean.name: Equiterrean

107-trained_mage.description: Trained Mages are not only gifted with arcane potential, but have already taken steps to hone and further develop it. Their stern gaze tells of years of intense study, their confidence of their ability to bend reality to their will. They know what power they hold, what they sacrificed to aquire it and have already set their eyes on gaining more.
107-trained_mage.name: Trained Mage

108-deathrite_harrower.description: The Deathrite Cult strives for a world silenced by death, an unliving utopia of crypts tended to by the mute Graveswardens. To hush those living beings disturbing the sacred silence of the Deathshroud, the Deathrite's High Crematorians dispatch legions of thralls, both mortal cultists and the Annointed, undead beings bound or birthed into the ranks of the Deathrite. Among these Annointed are the Deathrite Harrowers, hateful souls that gave their life in service of the Deathrite, now carrying a holy mandate to silence the blasphemous beating of hearts and turn all that is living into blessed ash.
108-deathrite_harrower.name: Deathrite Harrower

109-henge_guardian.description: Henge Guardians are ancient constructs carved by shamans from blessed rock, acting as arbiters of peace and bulwarks against intruders from beyond the veil of the mundane world. Within the Guardian reside ancestral spirits of ages past, souls of chiefs, warriors, shamans or figures of importance to the tribesfolk, empowering the towering stonework of their collective body with the desire to protect their kin and continually serve the tribe in death.
109-henge_guardian.name: Henge Guardian

110-apshait_ambusher.description: Apshait are named after mythical insects said to feast on the souls of the dead during their travels through the underworld. Those worrying about their immortal soul may be relieved to hear that the actual Apshait much prefer to feast on mortal bodies instead, making them a dangerous prospect for both lone travelers or armed transports traversing infested landscapes. Breeding in looming underground hives, the Asphait's expansive tunnel networks stretch far beyond the central hive chambers, where the Apshait soldier swarms utilize them to coordinate intricate ambushes.
110-apshait_ambusher.name: Apshait Ambusher

111-aerocyte_floatling.description: Without warning, Aerocyte Floatlings descend from the high heavens, graceful like jellyfish slow-dancing on mistral currents. Awe quickly turns into horror as these Airborne parasites attach to organic hosts and begin to inflate, eventually carrying their prey off into the sky. There the bulbous Stratohives float, waiting for their Floatlings to deliver sustenance. Once the hulking specimens have drained the hosts of all biomass, the Floatlings attach to their Stratohive, receiving their equal share. When continuously fed, Floatlings evolve into Stratohive, becoming the host for their own flottilla of Floatlings and beginning the cycle a new.
111-aerocyte_floatling.name: Aerocyte Floatling

111-aerocyte_floatling_inflated.description: Without warning, Aerocyte Floatlings descend from the high heavens, graceful like jellyfish slow-dancing on mistral currents. Awe quickly turns into horror as these Airborne parasites attach to organic hosts and begin to inflate, eventually carrying their prey off into the sky. There the bulbous Stratohives float, waiting for their Floatlings to deliver sustenance. Once the hulking specimens have drained the hosts of all biomass, the Floatlings attach to their Stratohive, receiving their equal share. When continuously fed, Floatlings evolve into Stratohive, becoming the host for their own flottilla of Floatlings and beginning the cycle a new.
111-aerocyte_floatling_inflated.name: Aerocyte Floatling Inflated

111-aerocyte_stratohive.description: Without warning, Aerocyte Floatlings descend from the high heavens, graceful like jellyfish slow-dancing on mistral currents. Awe quickly turns into horror as these Airborne parasites attach to organic hosts and begin to inflate, eventually carrying their prey off into the sky. There the bulbous Stratohives float, waiting for their Floatlings to deliver sustenance.
