Once the hulking specimens have drained the hosts of all biomass, the Floatlings attach to their Stratohive, receiving their equal share. When continuously fed, Floatlings evolve into Stratohive, becoming the host for their own flottilla of Floatlings and beginning the cycle a new.
111-aerocyte_stratohive.name: Aerocyte Stratohive

112-witherflesh_colossus.description: First created by the expert Fleshgrafters of the Burial Host, an endless column of shambling undead pressed into service by a council of arcane artisans with special interest in the possibilities offered by a staunch rejection of morality and ethics, the Witherflesh Colossi quickly became a staple in the arsenal of aspiring necromancers due to their hulking size, unearthly strength and customizable number of tearing, smashing and crushing limbs. While requiring a considerable starting investment of both necromantic energy and dead meat, the results speak for themselves and an expertly grafted Colossus is worth its weight in (albeit often blood-stained) gold.
112-witherflesh_colossus.name: Witherflesh Colossus

113-facestealer.description: Facestealers are demonic entities that revel in subjecting indiscriminate terror upon mortal beings. Their bulbous insectoid bodies are overgrown with faces and skulls in various states of decomposition, weeping, whispering, laughing or screaming. These are the results of the Facestealer's unique hunting methods, being able to draw creatures into a demonic realm where they are assailed by the Imprisoned Ones, waning shades of the demon's previous victims. If a creature succumbs to the demonic realm, its soul will be devoured by the Facestealer and its face joins the ingrown gallery upon the demon's bloated body.
113-facestealer.name: Facestealer

113-imprisoned_one.description: The Imprisoned Ones are the echoes of a Facestealer's victims populating the demonic realm lorded over by the demon. Waning shades of past beings consumed by the demonic energies of their captor, they have become part of the insidious process that once claimed their soul.
113-imprisoned_one.name: Imprisoned One

114-minotaur.description: For ages, scholars have been contemplating the origin of the mighty Minotaurs, bovine man-beasts of considerable strength, often exhibiting an inborn lust for battle and an innate understanding of ancient martial traditions. While civilized Minotaurs can be found in the ranks or even upper brass of mercenary bands or royal armies, feral specimens plague untamed lands or cut bloody swathes through frontier regions. Regardless of if they are the cursed children of a bestial progenitor or the products of a war god's special kind of divine intervention, Minotaurs embody mythical prowess in a way few creatures do.
114-minotaur.name: Minotaur

115-pirate_powder_dancer.description: Powder Dancers are part of a pirate ship's dedicated boarding crews, agile and tactically versatile fighters and marksmen well versed in the art of ship to ship combat. They constantly alternate between Melee and ranged weaponry, overwhelming the defenders with devastating point blank salvos from their characteristic flintlock pistols or pressuring them with aggressive bladework. Once the rhythmic, bellowing blasts fade away and the powder dust dissipates, the enemy ship has been taken.
115-pirate_powder_dancer.name: Pirate Powder Dancer

116-mawbloom_creepling.description: Creeplings are miniature Mawblooms in an infant stadium. They emerge from underground spawn-pods attached to the Mawbloom's Gravesroots and are the Mawbloom's primary form of reproduction, attaching to unsuspecting targets to drain them of nutrients, before seeking out new territories to become stationary and grow into Voracious Mawblooms themselves.
116-mawbloom_creepling.name: Mawbloom Creepling

116-voracious_mawbloom.description: Cultivated by the arcano-botanists of Ferdeaux as befitting guardians for their sprawling topiaries, the carnivorous Mawblooms boast a towering statue, toothed jaw-petals, growth-accelerated root-vines and acidic digestion glands. What started started out as controlled, if experimental, cultivation has spiraled into an ecological disaster, as the Mawblooms evolved an unintended reproducive method by producing so-called Creeplings. The miniature Mawblooms are capable of uprooting themselves and crawl on unnerving root-legs, extending their reach to explore new territories. Their rapid colonization has led to ecological havoc, as they multiply exponentially, choking out native flora and preying upon local fauna.
116-voracious_mawbloom.name: Voracious Mawbloom

117-skeletal_Gravesblade.description: Graveblades were capable warriors, their body and soul now enthralled by necromancy powerful enough to restore their martial abilities and fighting spirit. Not to be confused with the mindless shambling hordes of lesser undead they often command, they are creative in the way of using their undead form to their advantage, amplifying their martial strength with the possibilities opened up by an undying body. Their fiery passion and warrior's honour, however, transformed into the cruel coldness of the unliving, turning the Gravesblades into relentless executors of calculated and methodical slaughter.
117-skeletal_Gravesblade.name: Skeletal Graveblade

118-cyclops.description: Cyclopeans are tragic figurs, once the master smiths of giant kind, using their god-given power over the elements to forge storm-wreathed weaponry for the High Kings of the Storm Giants, the Frost Giant Jarls or Stone Giant Thanes. But these days are over, the few Cyclopeans left are pale shades of former glory, lumbering thin-blooded brutes who barely know how to swing their club, let alone a blacksmith's hammer. They are very suspicious, but once their mistrust has been overcome, they are trusting bordering gullibe - perhaps an indication that their downfall has been brought about by betrayal and that these wounds still linger.
118-cyclops.name: Cyclops

119-sand_elemental.description: The four major elemental planes share hidden borders, where their essences intermingle. As looming Magma Elementals populate the vast volcanic trenches below the endless oceans of the aquatic plane, the relentless rasp-winds of the aerial plane instill the terran plane's sand with life, causing Sand Elementals to rise from the arid dunes, finding their way through weak points of the planar veil into the profane world.
119-sand_elemental.name: Sand Elemental

120-vampire_dreg.description: Dregs are found at the bottom of the vampiric hierarchy, unloved offspring marked and transformed by the bestial nature of their sanguine legacy. They are driven by maddening hunger and the aching need to receive any semblance of acknowledgment from their creator. Once their hunger is satiated, they become even more dangerous, as the starved beast turns into a cunning predator, now pursuing its prey not out of desperation, but for its own debased amusement.
120-vampire_dreg.name: Vampire Dreg

121-sporeshambler.description: Sporeshamblers are humanoid husks overtaken by a fungal infestation. These hosts become questing tendrils of the mycotic collective, connected to the greater network in sporular communion. The collective is in a state of continuous adaptation, dissecting every impression felt and every experience gathered by the shambling extensions of its will. Should resistance arise, waves of Sporeshamblers surge against it until the collective has gathered enough information to grow hunter organisms perfectly attuned to the weaknesses of their dedicated prey.
121-sporeshambler.name: Sporeshambler

122-gutterfist.description: Gutterfists are hard-boiled brawlers, back alley thugs, prizefighters, or gentlemen pugilists. They hold their ground against better-armored foes with nothing but rock-hard abs, moxie, and their bare hands. Eventually, even veteran warriors might find themselves outmaneuvered and pinned to the ground as a hail of fists dents their priceless armor, all while the Gutterfist spouts filthy limericks concerning the promiscuous nature of their opponents' mothers.
122-gutterfist.name: Gutterfist

123-blackfeather_huntress.description: After the Black Rose Abbey was plundered and put to the torch by a band of roving robber-knights, the Abbess and her sworn sisters turned it into a briar-wreathed bastion and founded the clandestine order of Blackfeather Huntresses, an all female institution of knight-hunters sworn to neither king nor realm. Everyone can petition the Abbey to seek vengeance for unjust transgressions, abuse of power or breaking of chivalrous oaths. If the petition is granted, the Blackfeather Hunt is called and a pair of Huntressess seeks out their knightly prey.
123-blackfeather_huntress.name: Blackfeather Huntress

124-ogre_maneater.description: Ogres are gluttonous and vile in nature, wild ogres even more so than their more civilized kin who hire themselves out as extra muscle for legally questionable endeavors. Some Ogres, however, gradually become more debased in their insatiable search for more and more food, eventually becoming dangerous, blood-drunk brutes hellbent on driving their carious tusks into everything they encounter, even taking their attention of ongoing fights to gorge themselves on the fallen combatants - much to the horror of eventual onlookers.
124-ogre_maneater.name: Ogre Maneater

125-satyr.description: Satyrs are minor fey who dedicate their lives to the pursuit of pleasure and excess. Due to their natural curiosity, they often find their way into the mundane world through rifts and gaps between planes, where they eagerly interact with its inhabitants. The danger posed by Satyrs is not immediately apparent - their inherent fey magic can plunge mortals into a state of intoxication that leads them to dissolve into a state of hedonistic ecstasy, losing their awareness of place and time before collapsing from exhaustion. Additionally, the satyric temperament can become increasingly unpredictable as the festivities approach their climax, and not infrequently, under the influence of intoxicating substances, the otherwise amicable and sociable creatures reveal their unpredictable and alien fey nature.
125-satyr.name: Satyr

126-opulence_devil.description: Opulence Devils revel in subverting mortal structures and corrupting them from within, perhaps even more so than their infernal brethren. Concealed beneath the guise of opulent dignitaries, statesmen or merchant-princes bedecked in jewels, their ostentatious presence screams of extravagance and excess. They entice with promises and bargains, especially those who have little and crave much. Even in combat, these devils seek to tempt their foes, ultimately goading them into their own damnation.
126-opulence_devil.name: Opulence Devil

127-constrictor_drake.description: It doesn't take much imagination to understand why Constrictor Drakes bear their name, as they are the most serpentine of the lesser Wyverns, from their hunting methods to their puff adder-like jaws and tooth shape. They combine the worst qualities of snake and wyverns, resulting in a venomous, choke-happy, flying serpent the size of a horse. The Constrictor Drake's vivid warning colors only heighten one's unease because one can only imagine the kind of predator they are trying to deter.
127-constrictor_drake.name: Constrictor Drake

128-voidmare_wailer.description: Voidmare Wailers hail from the eponymous Voidmare, a nightmarish prison dimension steeped in cosmic darkness. Beings banished into the black cells of the Voidmare lose themselves in isolation and void-chill, eventually pupating and morphing into weeping and wailing monstrosities infused with the dimension's tortuous, hungering for the dreams and memories of living beings, their own lost forever.
128-voidmare_wailer.name: Voidmare Wailer

129-undead_archer.description: The legendary Undead Archers of the Burial Host serve as tireless artillery units, inexorable in their mission to provide cover for the marching troops. The Host's shambling hordes advance through a torrent of Rothail arrows. Even though their deteriorated musculature only allows the use of shortbows, they can be deployed further forward than regular archers, as an undead archer felled by return fire may rise again to continue their ceaseless barrage. Even when outmaneuvered and locked in Melee combat, the Host's archers refuse to yield, continuing their unrelenting volleys until physically incapable of doing so.
129-undead_archer.name: Undead Archer

130-automaton_enforcer.description: Automaton Enforcers represent the culmination of generations of arcane artistry and inventive genius. Hulking avatars of steam and steel, these constructs house arcane reactors capable of producing electrical discharges and executing protocols that mimic cognitive thought. While their utility is hampered by a lack of autonomy and the demands of intricate maintenance, they occasionally find purpose as coveted prestige items among esteemed guild artisans or as experimental support units within forward-thinking security forces.
130-automaton_enforcer.name: Automaton Enforcer

131-graftsman.description: Graftsmen occupy the lowest caste among the fleshcrafters of the Burial Host. As journeymen that have not yet passed their master's examination, they don't have access to the most choice resources from the Host's Limbchambers, Fleshpits and charnel houses. Instead, they have to scavenge battlefields or undertake personal raids in search of suitable parts for their projects. However, this makes them flexible and pragmatic improvisers who don't shy away from using less subtle and monstrous grafts, a practice frowned upon in the upper castes. Eager to practice advanced techniques on themselves, they are easily recognizable by their mismatched limbs, hulking statue and gruff demeanor.
131-graftsman.name: Graftsman

132-animated_blade.description: Animated Blades are swords imbued with arcane essence, a semblance of life breathing through them. This phenomenon can occur through enchantment magic, ancient rituals, or more rarely, the awakening of the blade itself. Driven by a deep-seated thirst for combat or an unquenchable desire for revenge, these blades act on their own, no longer requiring a wielder to carry out their intended purpose. Some of these blades are tasked with guarding treasure chambers or wizards' studies, while others tirelessly roam the the tombs and castles of their long-forgotten masters.
132-animated_blade.name: Animated Blade

133-ratfolk_gutterskulk.description: Wherever damp tunnel networks extend beneath sprawling cities, one can find those who have chosen the Undercity as their domain. Shunned by even the less human-like races due to their unsettling appearance and unsavory reputation, the parallel worlds beneath the great cities are often a realm of matted fur, gnashing teeth, and crooked blades. And if one takes a wrong turn in the tunnels, it's possible to find themselves confronted by a dozen pairs of yellow-gleaming eyes in the darkness.
133-ratfolk_gutterskulk.name: Ratfolk Gutterskulk

134-rock_golem.description: Hewn from solid rock, these lumbering behemoths lack the sophisticated intricacies of their more contemporary stone or metal counterparts. Instead, they embody the raw essence of ritualistic craftsmanship, of a time when the creation of golems was steeped in mystic rites rather than the precise incantations of modern magical science. The Rock Golem still harbors traces of elemental powers long lost to its more polished successors, echoing the ancient secrets of a lost era.
134-rock_golem.name: Rock Golem

135-skeletal_swashbuckler.description: Life at sea is perilous and offers myriad ways to meet an untimely demise be it disease, violence, or the raw brutality of the elements. Yet, amidst this danger, sailors have discovered diverse means to transcend mortality, seldom by choice. Ancient curses, bonds to captain, crew, and vessel transcending death, or the mystical sway of natural forces all ensure a sailor's journey sometimes doesn't conclude with death. The Skeletal Swashbucklers are undead mariners who defy decay, their bleached bones pulsating with a lingering thrill for adventure and peril, refusing to succumb to mere oblivion.
135-skeletal_swashbuckler.name: Skeletal Swashbuckler

136-tyrannosaurus_rex.description: Amidst the dense, primeval jungles of the Archipelago, lurks a creature whose presence alone invokes visions of primal power,the Tyrannosaurus Rex. Known as the Jungle Monarch in the indigenous xotl language, this colossal predator embodies an ancient and fearsome majesty that evolution wasn't able to improve upon. Its thunderous footfalls reverberate through the foliage, conjuring images of bygone eras of lost worlds and untamed wilderness. Its towering form and menacing maw evoke the very essence of raw, untamed nature, a prehistoric force that roams the land, instilling a sense of ancient danger and primal instincts in all who dare to wander these unforgiving territories.
136-tyrannosaurus_rex.name: Tyrannosaurus Rex

137-cannonade_crawler.description: The Cannonade Crawlers, colossal mega-arthopods renowned for their potent acid bombardments, possess a unique physiology fueled by arcane influences and distinctive biochemical compounds from their diet. They live a symbiotic lifestyle, residing in clusters called regiments, and often engage in battles for other creatures in exchange for sustenance. This mutual relationship has raised questions about a possible feralization from a previously domesticated state. Typically, these agreements involve the Crawlers defending hives, dens, or even villages in exchange for food resources from their employers. This strategic approach secures their survival while allowing them to utilize their specialized defense mechanisms as living artillery.
137-cannonade_crawler.name: Cannonade Crawler

138-back_alley_slasher.description: Back Alley Slashers are masters of the cobble-plastered underbelly's unique brand of fighting - swift, dirty bladework. They are quick to anger, seasoned, and ruthless, ever ready to exploit the crooked lanes and nestled alleys of their home city to their advantage. Those who don't meet their end in their initial conflicts often find their names whispered throughout the gutters, their police records filled with autopsy reports.
138-back_alley_slasher.name: Back Alley Slasher

139-witherflesh_ripper.description: At the feet of towering Witherflesh Colossi, swarms of Witherflesh Rippers gather ravenous undead controllable only through indirect manipulation of their collective swarm-like consciousness. Exposure to large groups of Rippers can transform ordinary undead into Rippers, their physiology swiftly adapting to satisfy the need for tearing and feeding. In regions already wrestling with the presence of undead, these circumstances can lead to additional Ripper epidemics.
139-witherflesh_ripper.name: Witherflesh Ripper

140-samurai.description: The Samurai, as a pop cultural icon, embodies honor, discipline, and swordsmanship in the collective imagination. Their significance resonates deeply in various forms of media, painting a picture of skilled warriors, bound by a martial code and pursuing an ideal of unwavering loyalty. The samurai's lore offers a wealth of themes: loyalty to a lord, a sense of duty, and the pursuit of personal honor. They bring an air of martial prowess and elegance,enhancing the thematic depth of a campaign. The duality of their stoic discipline and the emotional intensity beneath the surface makes them compelling adversaries. Their historical relevance and pop cultural impact make them an excellent choice for challenging and evocative encounters.
140-samurai.name: Samurai

141-troll_ironhead.description: Trolls have become increasingly prevalent within gangs, bands, or paramilitary organizations. Those distinguished by exceptional brutality and a spark of intelligence are clad in heavy plate armor and made to believe that nothing can overcome the combination of their thick skulls, natural regeneration, and full plate armor. Their belief in invulnerability renders them dangerously fearless, eagerly throwing themselves into the fray in pursuit of glory and plunder, facing the greatest dangers as waves of enemies crash upon them. However, should their defense be breached, doubts sprout within the troll's mind, either fermenting into paralyzing fear or boiling over into boundless rage.
141-troll_ironhead.name: Troll Ironhead

142-pyreling.description: Folklore describes Pyrelings as humans who succumbed to volcanic heat or ash smoke, their skeletons enriched with igneous rock and their souls burning with anger caused by their untimely demise. In actuality, Pyrelings are lesser elementals, fire-fickle beings manifesting in places of intense volcanic activity, either to a minor planar convergence or on the behest of greater elemental beings. Pyreling familiars are conceivably very popular among Pyromancers, as they are amicable, if hot-headed and vivacious, undemanding and worthwhile objects of study for those seeking insight into the very nature of fire itself.
142-pyreling.name: Pyreling

143-gnoll_trophy_hunter.description: Gnoll Trophy Hunters start off as typical gnolls, if one could consider a demon-born anthropomorphic hyena to be in any way normal. Some Gnolls display a targeted savagery that surpasses mere hunger; and, under the watchful gaze of their demonic progenitor, they are driven to hunt for increasingly grand prey. Every battle becomes a personal pursuit for trophies, and soon, only the flesh of elite warriors or pack alphas can momentarily sate their all-consuming hunger.
143-gnoll_trophy_hunter.name: Gnoll Trophy Hunter

144-tactician.description: No strategy survives first enemy contact, a statement that is tried and tested. Those taking to the field themselves to make sure that a mind equal to those devising strategy will see it adapted to the flow of the encounter are strategists no longer, but Tacticians. Tutored in all manners of practical warfare by military academies or veterans, these Tacticians are effective force multipliers on the battlefield, assessing threats, relaying immediate orders and acting as the tactical lynchpin for small to medium-scale fighting forces.
144-tactician.name: Tactician

145-ghoul_bonegnawer.description: Bone Gnawers are more aggressive and feral than ordinary ghouls. Defying the image of lurking, gaunt and emaciated creatures, they are infused with unnatural strength, pouncing on their victims with unnatural bulk, unsettling body movements, and flesh-hungry savagery. Their Graves-cold hands choking the life from their victims, they often start feeding before the last breath is drawn.
145-ghoul_bonegnawer.name: Ghoul Bone Gnawer

146-bard.description: Few things are as impactful as music, mere sound touching creatures' souls, inspiring them, soothing or even frightening them. Within music itself resides an inherent power that can act as a catalyst, unleashing both subtle glamours or earth shattering spells. Not everyone can actively harness this special magic, but those who can, be it through the power of their genius, a grand personality or a deep understanding of the intricacies of the acoustic arcana, possess great power, whether in social situations or on the battlefield.
146-bard.name: Bard

147-witch_hunter.description: Witch Hunters coordinate the pursuit of magic users who fall outside the accepted framework of arcane arts. This may be related to religious structures, general prejudices, or well-founded fears regarding those who wield such incomprehensible power for many. Witch Hunters must possess strong wills and pursue their mission with nigh-fanatical devotion, otherwise, they can hardly hope to counteract the manifold magical powers with mundane means, be they subtle or obvious. Their work often drives them to the edge of morality and sometimes beyond, and many break under the responsibility that rests on their shoulders - making them particularly dangerous for those who seek to harm no one with their craft but still find themselves in the hunter's sights.
147-witch_hunter.name: Witch Hunter

148-spore_shepherd.description: Spore Shepherds are of tranquil demeanor, tending to the diverse mushroom colonies thriving in their territories, be it long-stalked or wide-capped varieties with wide, delicate fungi or blobs of slime mold. They make no distinction whether their wards are animate, sentient fungi or mundane mushrooms, although outsiders may hardly grasp the intricate mycotic processes and the assessment of fungal sentience. The Shepherds are fiercely protective of their flock and possess extensive mycotic networks, constantly providing them with information about their environment.
148-spore_shepherd.name: Spore Shepherd

149-gatekeeper.description: The role of Gatekeepers is to grant entry and, if necessary, prevent intrusion.  They do this with stoic elegance and an inherent sense of the theatrical demands and expectations of their role. Gatekeepers are the ultimate aesthetic embellishment to any throne room or fortress walkway, poised and ready to cross halberds and stop newcomers dead in their tracks, if only for a thrilling moment of suspense before stepping aside. Gatekeepers are renowned for their patience, their calm demeanor, unwavering loyalty, a flair for the dramatic and of course the combat skills to enforce the implied threat of their presence.
149-gatekeeper.name: Gatekeeper

150-ravager.description: Ravagers are nigh-legendary warriors whose physical abilities surpass human limits, reaching mythical proportions. Whether living in solitude or leading like minded individuals, their lives are defined by combat, whether born of the harsh circumstances of their origin or by choice. These indomitable warriors have been shaped by years or decades of struggle for survival, their bodies and minds hardened to resist forces that would break lesser beings.
150-ravager.name: Ravager

151-dwarven_battlemason.description: Battle-Masons epitomize the convergence of artisanal skill and martial expertise, exemplifying dwarven virtues. Hardened veterans and master craftsmen, they operate and fight in the most adverse conditions, often deployed during sieges or subterranean conflicts. Battle-Masons do not settle for just clearing a tunnel or capturing an enemy position. Materials are reinforced, equipment is set up instantly, and a position is only vacated when it is in better condition than when it was captured. Stern and steadfast, they are the reliable force to turn to in times of crisis, offering expertise in high-pressure environments.
151-dwarven_battlemason.name: Dwarven Battlemason

152-tunnelterror_gorgeworm.description: When a Gorgewormling detects a rich food source or manages to attach unnoticed as a parasite to larger beings, it rapidly grows to immense size. The fully grown Gorgeworm, driven mad by hunger, then burrows through the earth, devouring everything that falls within the reach of its scythe-like mandibles. Though tenacious prey may escape from the worm's gullet, they are often left with a Broodspawn attached, an undulating egg sac from which the asexually produced offspring of the worm hatch.
152-tunnelterror_gorgeworm.name: Tunnelterror Gorgeworm

152-tunnelterror_gorgeworm_broodspawn.description: When a Gorgewormling detects a rich food source or manages to attach unnoticed as a parasite to larger beings, it rapidly grows to immense size. The fully grown Gorgeworm, driven mad by hunger, then burrows through the earth, devouring everything that falls within the reach of its scythe-like mandibles. Though tenacious prey may escape from the worm's gullet, they are often left with a Broodspawn attached, an undulating egg sac from which the asexually produced offspring of the worm hatch.
152-tunnelterror_gorgeworm_broodspawn.name: Tunnelterror Gorgeworm Broodspawn

152-tunnelterror_gorgewormling.description: When a Gorgewormling detects a rich food source or manages to attach unnoticed as a parasite to larger beings, it rapidly grows to immense size. The fully grown Gorgeworm, driven mad by hunger, then burrows through the earth, devouring everything that falls within the reach of its scythe-like mandibles. Though tenacious prey may escape from the worm's gullet, they are often left with a Broodspawn attached, an undulating egg sac from which the asexually produced offspring of the worm hatch.
152-tunnelterror_gorgewormling.name: Tunnelterror Gorgewormling

153-mummy_tomb_thrall.description: Tomb Thralls were low-ranking devotees who did not necessarily follow their sovereign into death and embalmment willingly. In their current unliving state, their position remains unchanged, rendering them the lowest in hierarchy yet the numerically strongest force, reanimated by the transcendent power of their sovereign, blurring the boundaries between life and death. They serve either to protect their master's tomb, prepare for his return, or, if he has already risen, to march at the forefront against the living.
153-mummy_tomb_thrall.name: Mummy Tomb-Thrall

154-awakened_armor.description: In a world teeming with dragons, magic, or extraplanar incursions, some hardened adventurers lose respect for the simple dangers of the adventurer's life. An awakened armor stands as a towering suit of plate mail, devoid of the any weaknesses imposed by organic parts. It feels no pain and knows no mercy; the armor is a tool of overwhelming violence, advancing unstoppably through arrow volleys, hostile terrain or arcane fire.
154-awakened_armor.name: Awakened Armor

155-undead_deplorable.description: Deplorables is a catch-all term for undead creatures barely held together by waning dregs of necromantic energies coursing through their clotted veins. Reduced to decaying husks by ages of service, starvation or especially hostile working conditions, Deplorables make for the bottom tier of undead operatives. But as long as their bones haven't been ground to dust and their flesh hasn't fully withered, they keep on, shambling, crawling and creeping forwards at the behest of their dark masters, compensating their lack of redeeming qualities with sheer numbers and their indisputable tenacity. Often, these deplorables band together into hordes, descending upon living beings like waves of withered flesh and missing limbs.
155-undead_deplorable.name: Undead Deplorable

155-undead_deplorable_horde.description: Deplorables is a catch-all term for undead creatures barely held together by waning dregs of necromantic energies coursing through their clotted veins. Reduced to decaying husks by ages of service, starvation or especially hostile working conditions, Deplorables make for the bottom tier of undead operatives. But as long as their bones haven't been ground to dust and their flesh hasn't fully withered, they keep on, shambling, crawling and creeping forwards at the behest of their dark masters, compensating their lack of redeeming qualities with sheer numbers and their indisputable tenacity. Often, these deplorables band together into hordes, descending upon living beings like waves of withered flesh and missing limbs.
155-undead_deplorable_horde.name: Undead Deplorable Horde

156-carnax_hatchet_hulk.description: Carnax Hatchet-Hulks are formidable creatures, scaled behemoths resembling a green-scaled and axe-faced lump of stacked muscle mass moving with harrowing speed and bone-crushing momentum. Despite their ferocity, they are more complex than their bestial appearance and a cursory assessment of their behaviour lets on. It is common for a mature Carnax to seek an equal opponent in battle and, should they prove worthy, submit to them, forming a martial bond in and out of combat, mutually learning from one another as battle brothers, mutuals and mounts. Warriors able to forge such a bond with a Carnax often attain legendary renown, and the power of such a mighty ally often allows them to naturally or violently rise to the top of their respective hierarchical structures.
156-carnax_hatchet_hulk.name: Carnax Hatchet-Hulk

157-infernal_infanterist.description: Untold legions of lesser devils form the bulk of the infernal armies, born from soot, sulfur, and sin. Automatically under the command of the ruler whose domain they manifest in, they themselves have only minimal agendas, their emotional spectrum reduced to those traits necessary to wage war at their leader's behest. Yet, over the course of their service, they may gain power and consciousness, perhaps even managing to distinguish themselves among their peers and begin their ascent through the ranks of the hellish legions.
157-infernal_infanterist.name: Infernal Infanterist

158-infernal_immolator.description: Within the infernal realms, some factions of devils actively contemplate their roles in the construct of sin, punishment, and atonement. They are dismissed by the more straightforward fiends as esoterics, yet bloody wars have been fought over interpretations of infernal nature. Immolators belong to the more radical factions of these mystic covens, firmly convinced of their role as harbingers of the punishing, all-consuming fire. Surrounded by an ominous calm, they readily join infernal hosts as independent actors, and no sin escapes their sixfold gaze.
158-infernal_immolator.name: Infernal Immolator

159-vampire_chiropterror.description: Some Vampires attain the ability to tap deeply into the bestial aspect of their tainted blood, enabling them to assume a monstrous form alongside their humanoid guise. One such manifestation is the Chiropterror, bat-like brutes with innate mastery over sanguine biomancy, capable of enhancing their already considerable strength and speed through blood magic to truly terrifying heights. While some Vampires can transition between their charming, humanoid form and this monstrous one, others succumb to the call of the hunt, causing their outward appearance to truly mirror the beast within.
159-vampire_chiropterror.name: Vampire Chiropterror

160-skyshark.description: One might think that avoiding water would generally keep you safe from shark attacks. One would be wrong. Whether striking from lightning-lit storm clouds, deceptively calm cloud seas, or towering waves, Sky Sharks attack unexpectedly from both air or water, causing such bloodshed in their raids that all involved creatures are frequently overtaken by a primordial blood frenzy, tearing, hacking, and biting at each other in a blood-crazed haze.
160-skyshark.name: Sky Shark

161-sodden_cavalier.description: Battlefields are dreadful places, not only for the downtrodden foot soldiers, but also the shining mounted elite. Many a glorious cavalry charge ended miserably in knee-deep mud, the final breath of many a proud knight a brackish gurgle, far removed from any notion of honorable warfare or chivalric combat. Such humiliated knights emerge from swamps and marshlands as Sodden Cavaliers, eternally surrounded by cold, relentless rain, seeking the death in battle that was once denied to them.
161-sodden_cavalier.name: Sodden Cavalier

161-undead_steed.description: Cursed, or perhaps blessed, with undeath, whether once a noble war steed or a worn-out nag, this mount remains a loyal companion, tirelessly carrying its rider and their burdens despite its festering flesh and sloughing skin, if one can stomach the smell and endure the disgusted looks.
161-undead_steed.name: Undead Steed

162-brigand.description: Brigands, cast out or withdrawn from society, have forged a new home within the harsh spaces between cities and villages. Gathered into loose bands, they seek refuge in castle ruins or caverns, from which they launch coordinated raids and ambushes. Despite their ragtag weaponry and lack of military experience, these outcasts are not to be trifled with, for the harsh frontiers forge hardened men and women, most of whom know there is no turning back for them.
162-brigand.name: Brigand

163-infernal_bloodhowler.description: From the ranks of Infernal Infantry some devils stand out through sheer combat ferocity and brutality. These individuals are singled out and forced to engage in a ritualized duel. One combatant emerges as a Bloodhowler, swollen in stature and wielding an infernal axe, flash-forged at the apex of their duel, carrying the raging essence of the vanquished devil. From then on, the Bloodhowler serves as an infernal champion, leading the charge and calling upon the blood rain to sanctify their slaughter.
163-infernal_bloodhowler.name: Infernal Bloodhowler

164-rustblight_skeleton.description: Rustblights rise from the ancient sites of long-forgotten battles. Clad in the remnants of corroded armor and wielding rust-eaten weapons, they are embodiments of ruin and decay. Born of rust and rot, they stalk places marked by death and decline, ruthlessly attacking all that lives, as flesh, wood, and steel alike crumble under their unfeeling assault.
164-rustblight_skeleton.name: Rustblight Skeleton

165-chicken.description: Chickens are versatile and widely domesticated birds, essential to agricultural practices around the world. Known for their prolific egg-laying abilities and providing a reliable source of meat, they are a staple in many diets. Chickens are social creatures with distinct pecking orders, exhibiting interesting behaviors such as dust bathing and foraging.
165-chicken.name: Chicken

165-cow.description: With their characteristic placid demeanor, cows embody the idyll of agricultural life, a stark contrast to the struggles and terrors of the hunt. Domesticated over millennia, these bovine creatures are essential to the growth and prosperity of Civilizeds worldwide, providing milk, meat, and labor across cultures. Naturally docile and curious, they perfectly exemplify the peaceful pastoral landscapes they call home.
165-cow.name: Cow

165-goat.description: Goats are curious and resilient, embodying adaptability in diverse environments. Domesticated for thousands of years, these versatile creatures are valued for their milk, meat, and wool, making them essential to agriculture and livelihoods around the world. Known for their agility and ability to thrive in rugged terrain, goats symbolize independence and resourcefulness, playing a vital role in traditional farming practices.
165-goat.name: Goat

165-pig.description: Pigs are intelligent and adaptable animals, known for their social behavior and keen sense of smell. Pigs are omnivores and have a remarkable ability to forage, and possess a level of intelligence such that there is likely a significant intellectual overlap between the smartest pigs and the dumbest humans.
165-pig.name: Pig

166-jabberwook.description: All creatures inhabiting the Feywild are alien by default, born from the chaotic energies that shape this unfathomable plane or manifested on a whim by an Archfey or comparable entity. Few of these creations are as dangerously bizarre or uncomfortably alluring as the mighty Jabberwook, birthed from a collective surrealist nightmare shared by the deliriously drunk guests of a lavish banquet held by the Prince of the Morrowgleam Court.
166-jabberwook.name: Jabberwook

167-acolyte_of_murder.description: Those devoted to cults of murder, bloodshed, and other unsavory aspects of violence are prevalent in many settings. Acolytes of Murder represent a variant of these cultists, either already acting as the executive organs of their dark patrons or still in the process of proselytizing by joining armies, bandit gangs, or other seedy professions where they put their penchant for brutality and bloodshed to good use. Over time, they undergo subtle transformations, gaining inhuman traits like overgrown fangs, bloodshot, bestial eyes, or snarling snouts. They then seek out or return to the cult and act in unison with their kind, shedding blood and carrying out their patrons' bidding.
167-acolyte_of_murder.name: Acolyte Of Murder

168-city_guard_runner.description: City guards are as integral to the image of a fantasy city as thieves' guilds, pushy merchants, and arrogant aristocrats. They patrol the streets and are always ready to thwart the players' antics, as a party traditionally finds themselves on the wrong side of the law from time to time. While a single guardsman poses little challenge to a group of adventurers, it is their numbers and discipline that make the city watch a force to be reckoned with, especially when the lightly armed, mobile guards call in reinforcements in the form of their heavily armed special forces
168-city_guard_runner.name: City Guard Runner

169-mummy_tomb_vizier.description: Tomb-Viziers are lower overseers within the strict hierarchy of undead tomb structures. In life, they were officials who, due to their mundane blood, could neither hold governmental nor sacral offices, but still showed a talent for bureaucracy and organization. In death, they were rewarded with a position as Vizier. They hold command over low-ranking Tomb-Thralls or other minor undead and are tasked with keeping intrepid dungeon-delvers and Graves robbers at bay to prevent the premature awakening of higher ranked undead.
169-mummy_tomb_vizier.name: Mummy Tomb-Vizier

170-cult_oracle.description: Not every cult devoted to a greater, ominous power is in direct contact with the subject or object of their worship - on the contrary. Sometimes the dark power is not yet strong enough to communicate, and often the cult is still too insignificant to attract the dreaded attention of a presence worthy of a cult. A cult leader may claim to know the way for a while, but not every acolyte will remain satisfied with that indefinitely. Cult Oracles receive opaque, veiled messages, impressions, and impulses from their dark patron and try to interpret them in the interests of the cult. They represent a connection between the worldly-organizational level of a cult and the metaphysical power in the background, serving as messengers and spiritual leaders to their cult.
170-cult_oracle.name: Cult Oracle

171-blazing_skull.description: Engulfed in flames and fueled by rites of destruction, Blazing Skulls are undead creatures summoned to make use of their immense lust and widely recognized aptitude for fire-based devastation. Whether driven by a desire for vengeance against a world that wronged them or by a fundamental appetite for pyromania, unleashing one or more Blazing Skulls places the fate of the entire surrounding area on a knife's edge, as everything that can burn probably will.
171-blazing_skull.name: Blazing Skull

172-zealot_firebrand.description: Faith and devotion take many forms. The interaction of a truly devout person with the world can range from total reclusion and an ascetic lifestyle to the communicative itinerant preacher and the earnest missionary. Those who do not shy away from setting themselves on fire for greater visibility and driving the words of their holy book directly into someone's head are known as zealots. They are single-mindedly focused on living out their faith and will stop at nothing, least of all potential death, to stand up for what they perceive as divine truth.
172-zealot_firebrand.name: Zealot Firebrand

173-infernal_invocator.description: Throughout the infernal hierarchies of the Hells, numerous castes, cults, and covens of varying influence can be found. For instance, infernal immolators often belong to the mystics of the Burning Wheel, obsessed with atonement and hellfire. There are also those who delve deeply into the occult aspects of sacrifice, sin, and punishment. These experts in infernal occultism are known as Invocators, often traveling the planes in search of new insights and eagerly sharing their cruel knowledge. Within the infernal legions, they act as skilled spellcasters and summoners, always keen to apply their research and test their abilities against enemy spellcasters - of course after ensuring that the game is rigged in their favour.
173-infernal_invocator.name: Infernal Invocator

174-city_guard_halberdier.description: Halberdiers are part of the heavy assault troops of a well-equipped city guard, armored and relentless in both advancing and defensive combat. Halberdiers often serve as the stalwart core of a watch cadre, called upon in ongoing situations to effectively seal off locations or to confront particularly large or mounted opponents. Even large groups of rebellious agitators can be quickly brought to heel by a steadfast squad of Halberdiers.
174-city_guard_halberdier.name: City Guard Halberdier

175-bounty_hunter_breaker.description: Breakers are towering mountains of muscle, who often batter their targets to the brink of unconsciousness, if not beyond, before delivering them in a pitiful state. This bounty hunter archetype either operates with excessive aggression from the outset or exudes an unsettling calm, where the threat of sudden, escalating violence lurks behind every carefully chosen word.
175-bounty_hunter_breaker.name: Bounty Hunter Breaker

175-bounty_hunter_impaler.description: Impaler possesses the mentality of a hunter, but not one who sees the hunt as an honorable duel between hunter and prey. Instead, he is like a smug noble, who particularly relishes delivering the final blow to a harrowed, breathless and defenseless creature. Relentlessly, the spears and harpoons of the Impaler embed themselves in the flesh of his victims, and only when the fight has faded from the creature's eyes does this bounty hunter dare to close the distance, finishing off what's left to make the kill ready for delivery.
175-bounty_hunter_impaler.name: Bounty Hunter Impaler

175-bounty_hunter_stalker.description: Bounty Hunters of the Stalker archetype spend days or weeks trailing their targets, preparing for the perfectly orchestrated strike. They rely on stealth and subterfuge to get as close as possible to their target before using intricate knifework and vicious poison to make their point. If the initial assault proves ineffective, the Stalker is not above abandoning their posse to further wear down the target and retreat into the shadows, finding a new angle and setting up the next attack.
175-bounty_hunter_stalker.name: Bounty Hunter Stalker

175-bounty_hunter_trapper.description: Trappers excel at turning the entire area where their target is located into a massive environmental weapon. Every movement could trigger firebombs, shrapnel grenades, or pit traps. A skilled Trapper can instill such overwhelming paranoia in a creature that the burden of constantly endangering innocent lives becomes unbearable. This can lead the hunted person to surrender without a fight, no longer willing to be the subject of the trapper's sadistic ingenuity.
175-bounty_hunter_trapper.name: Bounty Hunter Trapper

176-moray_drake.description: Moray Drakes combine the most unpleasant aspects of two supremely dangerous creatures, both of which should be avoided for different reasons. These lesser dragons nest in coral reefs, coastal coves, and lush riverbanks, their territory easily recognizable due to accumulations of brightly coloured mucus and oozing globules, floating in the surrounding waters like bloated jellyfish. The gluttonous Drakes feed on anything that fits between their pharyngeal jaws, from fish and small marine mammals to humanoids unfortunate or foolish enough to venture into this creature's hunting grounds.
176-moray_drake.name: Moray Drake

177-cult_possessed.description: Not every cult is heard, and not every cultist is rewarded. Yet the gifts of the powers that reign over domains beyond mortal comprehension are rarely subtle, and they wreak havoc upon the human form. Seldom are those thus gifted still able to act with coherent thought, and more often than not, they are used by the spiritual leaders of the cult as vessels for communion or shepherded into battle, where the horrors of their inhuman forms are unleashed without hesitation.
177-cult_possessed.name: Cult Possessed

178-ogre_batter_brute.description: Clad in reinforced armor adorned with rough spikes, these ogres use their massive stature to hold their ground against larger foes or, as is often preferred by the individual ogres, to relentlessly bully weaker enemies. They wield their brutal shield for both offensive and defensive purposes, gleefully battering aside anything that dares to cross their path.
178-ogre_batter_brute.name: Ogre Batter-Brute

179-rime_wyvern.description: White Dragons adore the hunt, pursuing feral delight in seeking out and overpowering greater and greater prey. Powerful White Dragons are able to infuse Wyverns with a portion of their essence, bestowing a semblance of their master's elemental affinity and draconic might upon them. These Rime Wyverns serve as heralds and hounds, often initiating a hunt and harrowing the target relentlessly, before their master appears and delivers the finishing blow. If the dragon has devotees or subordinates, a Rime Wyvern might lead a portion of these forces into battle or serve as the great dragon's emissary, speaking on their behalf.
179-rime_wyvern.name: Rime Wyvern

180-desert_luremaw.description: By cruel coincidence or cosmic sadism, Luremaws are not confined to the depths of the ocean. There is a subspecies that lies buried in the scorching desert sands, waiting to ambush prey on land. Less mobile than their aquatic kin, but just as devious and perhaps even more dangerous due to easier access to prey by lurking along caravan routes or near oases these Desert Luremaws are yet another reason to exercise caution while adventuring within the desert.
180-desert_luremaw.name: Desert Luremaw

180-giant_luremaw.description: Normal-sized luremaws may not win any beauty contests, but due to their small size, they pose little danger to the average adventurer. However, encounters with one of the rare specimens that have grown to gigantic size are not only unpleasant but deadly. Anyone who thinks they can avoid these toothy ambush predators by dismissing their glowing lure as unappealing should be warned that those large, man-eating specimens have grown so big precisely because they know exactly how to lure those who venture into such inhospitable depths with the promise of rich rewards. And thus, many an experienced luremaw no longer dangles a typical glowing lure, but rather a bulging treasure chest or similarly enticing artifacts, while its massive body remains hidden in darkness or buried in the seabed.
180-giant_luremaw.name: Giant Luremaw

181-frost_wretch.description: Frost Wretches are the mortal remnants of unfortunate souls who met their end through harrowing cold, those who perished buried beneath snow or crushed by an avalanche. As the memories of warmth were slowly purged from their bodies and minds by the overwhelming frost, even death could not still their yearning. So powerful is their craving for the faintest touch of life-giving heat that their lifeless bodies rise again, driven by an unfulfilled desire for what was ultimately denied to them. These wretched wanderers now stalk the living, drawn to the warmth they can never reclaim, making them a peril to any who still carry the flame of life.
181-frost_wretch.name: Frost Wretch

182-barmaid.description: Equipped with a unique blend of joviality and crabbyness, a Barmaid can be either the worst nightmare or the most valuable ally to any adventurer, be it fresh-faced or battle-hardened. She rules the tavern with an iron fist, and it pays to respect the local rules and customs. First and foremost, because one should never cross someone with unfettered access to their food, the key to any room and a selection of thoroughly confirmable alibi. Likewise, most hospitality workers are just waiting for the chance to truly let off some steam and you should make sure not to be on the receiving end. However, the Barmaid knows the fate she has chosen, and if she truly despised the hustle and bustle, she'd probably find a different job, for example Warlord or Grand Inquisitor.
182-barmaid.name: Barmaid

183-goblin_pinecone_bomber.description: Goblins are nothing if not adaptable and creative in using the resources available to them to offset the advantages their enemies are blessed with. At the same time, a certain sadism cannot be denied. Pinecone Bombers remarkably sound like a myth, until the caravan passes through coniferous woodlands and the last thing the escort sees is a grinning goblin with impressive leg muscles, clinging to a tree trunk six meters up, fiddling with a pinecone, before the explosions knock them off their horse and everything goes black.
183-goblin_pinecone_bomber.name: Goblin Pinecone Bomber

184-rot_cerf.description: Rot Cerfs are ghastly to behold, towering, monstrous stag-beings with half-decayed visages, heralded by the cracking of aged leaves and a pungent scent of damp moss mingled with the sweet stench of rot. Yet these creatures are not of undead nature; they embody the eternal cycle of death, decay, and rebirth, the hulking creature being both rot-bringer and life-birther. It is said that a single touch of its gnarled claws can infest a creature with unyielding decay, yet it is also supposed to possess healing powers of mythical proportions, capable of bringing a soul back from beyond the realm of death.
184-rot_cerf.name: Rot Cerf

185-hunting_wyvern.description: Born from humanity's curious impulse to subjugate every fanged and clawed horror that makes the mistake of gazing from the forest's edge into campfire-lit clearings, Hunting Wyverns are the result of breeding what once were draconic behemoths into something resembling a even more psychotic bird. Through millennia of costly and loss-ridden endeavors, wealthy nobles can now field Hunting Wyverns, surprisingly intelligent and lightning-fast upgrades over traditional falcons, surpassing them both in ability and prestige.
185-hunting_wyvern.name: Hunting Wyvern

186-vampire_huntress.description: While the thin-blooded, more beastly vampires display no particular preference regarding the source of their well-known primary sustenance, among the more civilized and haughty specimens, one observes a regrettable and troublesome inclination towards the fairer sex. It is scarcely surprising, therefore, that this provokes a reaction, prompting some young ladies to proactively preempt potential transgressions by embarking upon a career as vampire huntresses, often with great success.
186-vampire_huntress.name: Vampire Huntress

187-skeletal_dune_raider.description: Only to the untrained eye does the desert appear lifeless, that much is known. Yet, alongside the life that blossoms in the sands, un-life flourishes as well. Numerous undead creatures haunt the dunes, wadis, and oases of many an arid Wastelands. Among them are the Skeletal Dune Raiders, the skeletal remnants of ill-fated desert marauders and caravan ambushers, infused with the arid essences of their Graves sites and unwilling to return beneath the sands alone.
187-skeletal_dune_raider.name: Skeletal Dune Raider

190-casket_crawler.description: Casket Crawlers are undead forms shackled to a coffin by method of nail and stake, serving necromancers and fleshcrafters as mobile storage and subject of abuse.
190-casket_crawler.name: Casket Crawler

191-city_guard_nightlight.description: The city guard nightlight is a flavourful addition to any city watch, patrolling the nightly streets with its trusty lantern.
191-city_guard_nightlight.name: City Guard Nightlight

192-alchemist.description: the alchemist showcases what's possible when you get creative with magic, a great centerpiece for a story revolving around the dangers of unchecked arcana.
192-alchemist.name: Alchemist

193-Graves_golem.description: A shambling colossus of burial earth, its flesh a patchwork of Gravesstones, wilted remains, and shifting, restless dead.
193-Graves_golem.name: Grave Golem

193-Gravesstones.description: Gravesstones only serve as markers for the Graves Golem.
193-Gravesstones.name: Gravesstones

194-knight_mounted.description: the mounted knight is the ultimate symbiosis of man and beast, clad in heavy iron and propelled forth by half a ton of pure muscle tricked into charging towards danger.
194-knight_mounted.name: Knight Mounted

194-knight_unmounted.description: Even removed from his steed, a knight boasts nearly unparalleled martial might, utilizing their heavy plate as an extension of their body, rather than a hindrance.
194-knight_unmounted.name: Knight Unmounted

195-orc_iron_bulwark.description: Clad in the thickest plate and wielding spiked slab shields, iron bulwarks serve as the anchor points of the heavily armored iron fist formations.
195-orc_iron_bulwark.name: Orc Iron Bulwark

196-orc_chieftain.description: Chieftains seek out strong opponents to rip holes into the enemy formations by disposing of their leaders
196-orc_chieftain.name: Orc Chieftain

197-soulgrasp_mirror.description: The Soulgrasp Mirror is a possessed construct capable trapping and imprisoning creatures.
197-soulgrasp_mirror.name: Soulgrasp Mirror

198-gnoll_fleshtaker.description: Flesh-Takers ensure that every battle yields morsels of meat, which they collect and distribute strategically to maintain the horde's momentum.
198-gnoll_fleshtaker.name: Gnoll Flesh-Taker

199-ghostflicker_candelabra.description: The ghostflicker candelabra is a majestic animated chandelier dousing unsuspecting creatures with ethereal fire.
199-ghostflicker_candelabra.name: Ghostflicker Candelabra

200-city_guard_interrogator.description: The interrogators are a specialized unit within the city guard, tasked with hunting down and neutralizing rogue magic users.
200-city_guard_interrogator.name: City Guard Interrogator

201-siege_troll.description: Siege trolls are bred to charge, breach and hold fast, able to defend a beachhead against overwhelming odds.
201-siege_troll.name: Siege Troll

202-curseroot_bloomblight.description: The bloomblight infects creatures with cursed seeds that bloom violently under its radiant gaze.
202-curseroot_bloomblight.name: Curseroot Bloomblight

203-yeti_frostfiend.description: Frostfiends attack suddenly from the cover of storm-battered snow squalls, capable of tearing a seasoned adventurer limb from limb in a matter of seconds
203-yeti_frostfiend.name: Yeti Frostfiend

204-nightmaiden.description: Nightmaidens serve senior night hags in hopes of ascending into the coven, whether through merit or sororicide.
204-nightmaiden.name: Nightmaiden

205-torn_titan.description: The Torn Titan is a bisected, undead giant flailing with its titanic sword.
205-torn_titan.name: Torn Titan

206-unhinged_mimic.description: The Unhinged Mimic is a mimic teeming with parasites that can animate objects and control players.
206-unhinged_mimic.name: Unhinged Mimic

207-mind_tyrant_vivisector.description: The Vivisector seeks understanding by means of psychological and psionic torture.
207-mind_tyrant_vivisector.name: Mind Tyrant Vivisector

208-living_fossil_mammoth.description: Ancient fossils infused with primordial magic awaken, combining primal might and elemental power.
208-living_fossil_mammoth.name: Living Fossil Mammoth

209-great_thinker.description: The Great Thinker is the extracted brain of a powerful Mind T instrumentalized as a psionic nexus.
209-great_thinker.name: Mind Tyrant Great Thinker

210-Awakened_Instruments.description: Awakened musical instruments wield magical songs, often yearning for their own artistic freedom.
210-Awakened_Instruments.name: Awakened Instruments

212-Uvargandr.description: A flightless dragon with massive jaws, lightning attacks and a temper.
212-Uvargandr.name: Uvargandr

189-Hellspawned_Homunculus.description: Hellspawn from cursed pits: warped, blade-limbed, warded horrors, immune to fear, reason, and most magic.
189-Hellspawned_Homunculus.name: Hellspawned Homunculus
